Deposit Refund: The deposit is refundable and must be returned by the Licensor within 30 days of the Licensee vacating the premises. Responsibility for Charges Paid by Licensor (Owner): Property taxes and society charges. Paid by Licensee (Occupant): Electricity and water charges. Legal Conditions No Tenancy: It is expressly agreed that this is a Leave and License Agreement and shall not be construed as a lease or tenancy. The Licensee has no right, title, or interest in the premises. Vacation Clause: Upon expiry or earlier termination, the Licensee must vacate the premises and hand over peaceful and vacant possession to the Licensor.

text: MUTUAL NON-DISCLOSURE AGREEMENT This non-disclosure agreement (“Agreement”) is by and between Indian Institute of Technology Bombay, a research and educational institution of national importance, set up by a Special Act of the Parliament of Republic of India, having its address at Powai, Mumbai 400076 (“IITB”) and LegalEase Labs Pvt. Ltd., a corporation having a business address at No. 9, 2nd Floor, Parkview Business Centre, Bandra East, Mumbai 400051 (hereinafter referred to as “Company”) on this 1st day of July 2024 being the date when this agreement comes into force. I. RECITALS A. IITB and Company wish to exchange certain information pertaining to research and pilot deployment of automated contract clause extraction and summarization tools. This exchange includes all communication of information between the parties in any form whatsoever, including oral, written and machine-readable form, pertaining to the above which is indicated as confidential. B. IITB and Company wish to exchange the information for the sole purpose of evaluating and piloting a contract analysis prototype and each party regards certain parts of the Information it possesses to be secret and desires to protect those parts from unauthorized disclosure or use (such secret parts being hereafter collectively referred to as “Information”). C. IITB and Company are willing to disclose Information (as “Disclosing Party”) and receive Information (as “Receiving Party”) as the case be, on the terms and conditions set forth herein. II. AGREEMENT The Receiving Party will: a. Not disclose Information of Disclosing Party to any other person and use at least the same degree of care to maintain the Information confidential as Receiving Party uses in maintaining as confidential its own confidential Information, but always at least a reasonable degree of care; due diligence will be taken by both parties in maintenance of confidential information. b. Use the Information only for the above mentioned purpose; c. Restrict disclosure of the Information of the Disclosing Party solely to those employees of Receiving Party having a need to know such Information in order to accomplish the purpose stated above; d. Advise each such employee, before he or she receives access to the Information, of the obligations of Receiving Party under this Agreement, and require each such employee to agree to maintain those obligations. e. Within fifteen (15) days of notice furnished by either party, the party receiving such notice shall return to the other Party all documentation, copies, notes, diagrams, computer memory media and other materials containing any portion of the Information, or confirm to the other Party, in writing, the destruction of such materials. This Agreement imposes no obligation on Receiving Party with respect to any portion of the Information received from Disclosing Party which: a. was known to Receiving Party prior to disclosure by Disclosing Party, b. is obtained by Receiving Party from a third party under no obligation of confidentiality, c. is or becomes generally known or publicly available other than by unauthorized disclosure, d. is independently developed by Receiving Party or e. is disclosed by Disclosing Party to a third party without a duty of confidentiality on the third party. f. is required by law or decree. The Information shall remain the sole property of Disclosing Party. The Disclosing party does not make any representations or warranties, whether written or oral, statutory, express or implied with respect to the information which may be provided hereunder, including without limitation, any warranty of merchantability or of fitness for a particular purpose. The Disclosing party shall not be liable for any special, incidental or consequential damages of any nature whatsoever resulting from receipt or use of the information by the Receiving Party. Neither the execution of this Agreement nor the furnishing of any Information hereunder shall be construed as granting either expressly or by implication, any license under or title to any invention, patent, copyright, trademark or trade name now or hereafter owned by or controlled by the party furnishing the Information. The Receiving Party will not export, directly or indirectly, any technical data acquired from Disclosing Party or any product utilizing any such data to any third party, without first obtaining approval of the Disclosing Party. The rights and obligations of the parties under this Agreement may not be sold, assigned or otherwise transferred (subject to contract). The term of this Agreement shall be for a period of 2 (two) years and the obligations of confidentiality shall continue for a period of two (2) years after the termination of the Agreement. This Agreement can be terminated on thirty (30) days written notice by either party. However, Receiving Party’s obligations of confidentiality and restrictions on use of the Information disclosed by Disclosing Party shall survive termination of this Agreement for a period of two (2) years thereafter. This agreement will be construed and governed in accordance with the laws of India. Any dispute arising out or in connection with the agreement shall be settled within the jurisdiction of Mumbai courts. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this agreement effective as of the date first written above. For Indian Institute of Technology Bombay Name : Dr. S. Raghavan Designation : Registrar, IIT Bombay Date : 01/07/2024 For LegalEase Labs Pvt. Ltd. Name : Ms. Meera Kapoor Designation : Chief Executive Officer Date : 01/07/2024 Witness : Mr. Arjun Patel Witness : Ms. Shalini Rao
summary: This document is a Mutual Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA) signed on July 1, 2024, between Indian Institute of Technology Bombay (IITB) and LegalEase Labs Pvt. Ltd. (Company). Both parties are entering into the agreement to share sensitive information while protecting its secrecy. Purpose and Scope of Confidentiality Purpose of Exchange: The parties are exchanging confidential information solely for the purpose of evaluating and piloting a contract analysis prototype. This project relates to the research and deployment of automated contract clause extraction and summarization tools. Information Covered (Confidential Information): This includes all communication (oral, written, or machine-readable) pertaining to the project that is indicated as confidential. The Mutual Obligation: Both IITB and the Company serve as both the Disclosing Party (sharing information) and the Receiving Party (receiving information). Obligations of the Receiving Party The party that receives the confidential information must: Maintain Secrecy: Not disclose the information to any other person. Standard of Care: Use at least the same and always a reasonable degree of care to protect the information as they use for their own confidential data. Limited Use: Use the information only for the evaluation and piloting purpose stated above. Restrict Access: Share the information only with employees who have a "need to know" it for the stated purpose. Employee Requirement: Inform those employees of the confidentiality obligations and require them to agree to maintain those obligations. Return or Destroy: Within fifteen (15) days of being asked, the Receiving Party must either return all documents, copies, notes, and media containing the information or provide a written confirmation of their destruction. Exclusions to Confidentiality (When Disclosure is Permitted) The Receiving Party has no obligation to protect information that: It already knew before the agreement. It obtains from a third party who has no confidentiality obligation. Is or becomes publicly known through means other than unauthorized disclosure. It independently developed. The Disclosing Party disclosed to another party without a duty of confidentiality. Is required to be disclosed by law or court decree. Warranties, Property, and Term Ownership: The information remains the sole property of the Disclosing Party. Warranties: The Disclosing Party makes no warranties (express or implied) regarding the information, including merchantability or fitness for a particular purpose, and is not liable for any damages resulting from its use. No License: This agreement does not grant any express or implied license or title to any patent, copyright, trademark, or invention. Export Restriction: The Receiving Party must not export the technical data acquired from the Disclosing Party to any third party without prior approval. Agreement Term: The agreement is in force for a period of two (2) years from the start date (July 1, 2024). Termination: The agreement can be terminated by either party with thirty (30) days written notice. Survival: Regardless of when the agreement ends, the obligations of confidentiality and restrictions on use will continue for an additional period of two (2) years thereafter. Governing Law: The agreement is governed by the laws of India, and any disputes will be settled within the jurisdiction of Mumbai courts.

text: ?100/- NON-JUDICIAL STAMP PAPER TELANGANA STATE STAMP DUTY PAID VIDE E-STAMP NO. TG123456789012345, DATE: 28/10/2025 LOAN AGREEMENT (Reverse Mortgage Loan) THIS LOAN AGREEMENT made at Hyderabad, this 28th day of October, 2025, BETWEEN 1. State Bank of India, a banking company within the meaning of the Banking Regulation Act, 1949, having its Head Office at State Bank Bhavan, Nariman Point, Mumbai – 400021 and a branch office at Banjara Hills Branch, Hyderabad – 500034 (hereinafter referred to as “the Lender” which expression shall, unless repugnant to the subject or context, include its successors and assigns) of the One Part; AND 2. Mr. Ramesh Rao, S/o Late M. Krishnamurthy, aged about 68 years, residing at House No. 45-2/9, Road No. 3, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad – 500034, hereinafter referred to as “the Borrower” (which expression shall, unless repugnant to the subject or context, include his heirs, executors, administrators, and permitted assigns) of the Other Part. WHEREAS (A) The Borrower is a senior citizen and the absolute owner of the self-acquired and self-occupied residential house property described in Schedule I hereto (“the Residential Property”) and has applied to the Lender for a loan of Rs. 40,00,000/- (Rupees Forty Lakhs only) against the security of the said residential property. (B) The Lender, based on the application and documents submitted, has agreed to grant the said loan to the Borrower upon the terms and conditions set forth herein. ARTICLE 1 – DEFINITIONS AND INTERPRETATION (All standard clauses retained as per the original agreement.) ARTICLE 2 – PURPOSE OF THE LOAN 2.1 Purposes for which the Loan will be used: Renovation and upkeep of the Borrower’s residential property. Medical and emergency expenses for self and family. Supplementing pension income. 2.2 Loan not to be used for: Any commercial, speculative, or trading activity. ARTICLE 3 – AGREEMENT AND TERMS OF THE LOAN 3.1 Amount of Loan: Rs. 40,00,000/- (Rupees Forty Lakhs Only). The property shall be revalued every five (5) years by the fair market value method. 3.2 Disbursement: The loan shall be disbursed in quarterly instalments directly to the Borrower’s savings account (No. XXXXXXXXXXXX) maintained with SBI, Banjara Hills Branch. 3.4 Interest: The principal amount shall carry an interest rate of 8.5% per annum, compounded quarterly. 3.7 Prepayment: The Borrower may prepay the loan at any time without penalty. 3.8 Loan becomes due: (a) Upon the death of the Borrower. (b) Upon sale of the property. (c) Upon the Borrower’s permanent relocation elsewhere. 3.9 Settlement: The outstanding loan with interest shall be recovered from the sale proceeds of the mortgaged residential property after giving a 2-month period to the Borrower’s legal heirs to settle it voluntarily. ARTICLE 4 – SECURITY AND GUARANTEE The loan shall be secured by an exclusive registered mortgage of the residential property described in Schedule I below. The Lender shall also obtain a disbursement guarantee from the National Housing Bank. ARTICLE 5 – CONDITIONS PRECEDENT The Borrower shall: Furnish all title deeds of the property. Provide age and identity proof. Execute mortgage documents and declarations confirming that the property is self-occupied and free from encumbrances. ARTICLE 6 – BORROWER’S COVENANTS Maintain the property in good condition. Keep it insured against fire, flood, and natural calamities. Not let out or transfer possession to any third party. Inform the Lender of any major structural changes or relocation. ARTICLE 7 – WARRANTIES The Borrower declares: The property is free from all encumbrances, charges, or disputes. All taxes and dues are paid up to date. The Borrower has absolute and marketable title to the property. ARTICLE 8 – REMEDIES OF THE LENDER In case of default or breach, the Lender may: Declare the entire outstanding amount immediately payable. Enforce the mortgage and sell the property after notice. Recover dues from sale proceeds subject to applicable law. ARTICLE 9 – WAIVER Any waiver by the Lender shall not constitute a waiver of subsequent defaults. ARTICLE 10 – EFFECTIVE DATE This Agreement shall come into force on the date of execution, i.e., 28th October 2025, and shall continue until full repayment or settlement of the loan. ARTICLE 11 – GENERAL PROVISIONS All notices shall be addressed as follows: Lender: State Bank of India, Banjara Hills Branch, Hyderabad – 500034 Email: manager.bh@sbi.co.in Borrower: Mr. Ramesh Rao, H.No. 45-2/9, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad – 500034 Email: rameshrao@gmail.com IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Borrower has executed this Agreement and a duplicate hereof on the day, month, and year first written above, and the Lender has caused the same to be executed by its authorized officer. SIGNED AND DELIVERED BY Mr. Ramesh Rao (Borrower) in the presence of: ______________________ (Witness) Address: ___________________________ Signature: __________________________ ______________________ (Witness) Address: ___________________________ Signature: __________________________ SIGNED AND DELIVERED BY For State Bank of India, by Mr. S. K. Iyer, Assistant General Manager (Loans), SBI Banjara Hills Branch, Hyderabad. SCHEDULE – I (Description of the Mortgaged Residential Property) All that piece and parcel of residential property situated at House No. 45-2/9, Road No. 3, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad – 500034, admeasuring 310 square yards, together with a two-storey building constructed thereon and bounded as follows: North: Road No. 3, Banjara Hills South: Property of Mr. K. Srinivas East: Property of Mrs. Leela Reddy West: Property of Mr. V. N. Rao
summary: This document is a Reverse Mortgage Loan Agreement made on October 28, 2025, between State Bank of India (SBI) (the Lender) and Mr. Ramesh Rao (the Borrower), a senior citizen. This loan allows Mr. Rao to receive money against the value of his home while continuing to live there. The Loan and Its Purpose Amount: Mr. Rao is taking a loan of ?40,00,000 (Forty Lakhs) from SBI. Collateral (Security): The loan is secured by a registered mortgage on his residential house (House No. 45-2/9, Banjara Hills). This means the bank has a legal claim on the property. The property will be re-valued by the bank every five years. Interest Rate: The loan carries an interest rate of 8.5% per year, compounded (calculated and added) quarterly. Disbursement: The total loan amount will not be given all at once but will be paid in quarterly installments directly into Mr. Rao's SBI savings account. Permitted Uses: Mr. Rao can use the money for renovating his home, covering medical or emergency costs, and supplementing his pension income. Forbidden Uses: The money cannot be used for any commercial, speculative, or trading business activity. When the Loan is Due Unlike a standard loan, no monthly payments are required. The full loan amount (principal plus all accumulated interest) only becomes due upon certain events: Death of Mr. Rao. Sale of the residential property. Mr. Rao permanently moves out of the residential property. Repayment and Property Sale Legal Heirs' Option: Once the loan is due (usually upon death), Mr. Rao's legal heirs are given a two-month period to voluntarily settle the outstanding amount (pay it off). Bank's Action: If the heirs do not settle the amount, the total outstanding loan and interest will be recovered by the bank through the sale of the mortgaged property. Prepayment: Mr. Rao can choose to pay back the loan at any time without any penalty. Mr. Rao's Key Promises (Covenants) Property Condition: He promises to maintain the house in good condition and keep it insured against disasters (fire, flood, etc.). Ownership: He confirms the property is free from all legal issues, charges, or disputes and that all taxes are paid. No Transfer: He cannot rent out the property or sell/transfer possession of the house to any third party without the bank's knowledge. Notification: He must inform the bank of any major structural changes or if he permanently relocates.

text: RELEASE DEED (for Agriculture Lands) THIS DEED OF RELEASE is made and executed on this the 15th day of March, 2024, year by Sri. Ramesh Reddy, S/o. Late Narayana Reddy, aged about 52 years, Occupation: Farmer, Resident of D.No. 4-85, Ramapuram Village, Kurnool District, Andhra Pradesh. (Hereinafter called the “RELEASOR”) IN FAVOUR OF Sri. Suresh Reddy, S/o. Late Narayana Reddy, aged about 47 years, Occupation: Farmer, Resident of D.No. 4-92, Ramapuram Village, Kurnool District, Andhra Pradesh. (Hereinafter called the “RELEASEE”) The terms “RELEASOR” and “RELEASEE” herein used shall, wherever the context so admits, mean and include their respective heirs, executors, successors, administrators and assignees, etc. WHEREAS the Releasor and the Releasee are the sole and absolute joint owners of the agriculture land bearing Survey No. 142/3, admeasuring 3 Acres 25 Guntas, situated at Ramapuram Village, Orvakal Mandal, Kurnool District, which was inherited from their father, Late Narayana Reddy, through a registered Sale Deed No. 2145/1985, Book 1 of S.R.O. Orvakal, copied in Volume No. 68, at Page 45, vide Pattadar Passbook No. KNR/4589, Title Deed No. TD/512, issued by the M.R.O. Orvakal. The scheduled property has been inherited by the Releasor and Releasee herein from Late Narayana Reddy, who acquired the said property by means of the above-mentioned registered sale deed and died intestate on 12th August 2010, leaving the Releasor and Releasee as his legal heirs. Hence, they have become co-parceners of the scheduled property. WHEREAS the said property is fully described in the Schedule hereunder and delineated in the plan annexed, with the boundaries thereof shown in red color. WHEREAS the parties hereto are unable to enjoy the said property jointly and the said property is incapable of division by metes and bounds for convenient separate enjoyment. WHEREAS the Releasor has decided to release his 50% joint right in respect of the above-said property in favour of the Releasee, and the Releasor has not taken any consideration from the Releasee in respect of the schedule property, which the Releasor hereby acknowledges. NOW THEREFORE, this Deed of Release witnesses that, in pursuance of the said offer, the Releasor does hereby release, renounce, relinquish and disclaim his 50% joint right, title and interest in the said property in favour of the Releasee to have and to hold the same as absolute owner of the said property exclusively, together with ways, liberties, privileges, easements and appurtenances belonging or appertaining thereto. The Releasee shall henceforth enjoy the said property as the sole and absolute owner, without any interruption or disturbance from the Releasor or any person claiming under him. The Releasor hereby assures the Releasee that he has not encumbered his 50% joint right in the said property and shall indemnify the Releasee if any such encumbrance is found to exist. The Releasor agrees to co-operate with the Releasee to get the said property mutated exclusively in the name of the Releasee in revenue records. There is no house or any construction in the said land. The Releasor further declares that the schedule land is not attracted by the provisions of the A.P. Land Reforms (Ceiling on Agricultural Holdings) Act, 1973. The land is not an assigned land within the meaning of the A.P. Assigned Lands (Prohibition of Transfers) Act, 1977, and it does not belong to or is under mortgage to any government agency or undertaking. The Releasor hereby declares that there are no Mango Trees, Coconut Trees, Betel Leaf Gardens, Orange Groves, Mines, Quarries, or Fish Ponds in the said land. If any suppression of facts is noticed later, the Releasor shall be liable for prosecution as per law and payment of deficit duty. There are no other co-owners to the said property except the Releasor and the Releasee. SCHEDULE OF PROPERTY All that the piece and parcel of agricultural land bearing Survey No. 142/3, admeasuring 3 Acres 25 Guntas, situated in Ramapuram Village, Orvakal Mandal, under the jurisdiction of Sub-District Orvakal and Registration District Kurnool, bounded by: NORTH: Land of Mr. Srinivasulu Reddy SOUTH: Village Boundary EAST: Land of Mr. Venkata Reddy WEST: Panchayat Road IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Releasor hereunto has set his hand to this Deed of Release on the day, month and year first above mentioned, in the presence of the following witnesses: WITNESSES: Mr. Pradeep Reddy, Advocate, Kurnool. Mr. Ravi Teja, Farmer, Ramapuram Village. (Signed) RELEASOR: Sri Ramesh Reddy RELEASEE: Sri Suresh Reddy
summary: This document is a Deed of Release executed on March 15, 2024, concerning agricultural land in Ramapuram Village, Kurnool District, Andhra Pradesh. Parties Involved RELEASOR (The Giver): Sri. Ramesh Reddy (aged 52), who is giving up his share. RELEASEE (The Receiver): Sri. Suresh Reddy (aged 47), who is accepting the full rights. Both are sons of Late Narayana Reddy. Property and Background Property: Agricultural land bearing Survey No. 142/3, admeasuring 3 Acres 25 Guntas, situated at Ramapuram Village, Orvakal Mandal, Kurnool District. Ownership: The land was jointly owned by the Releasor and the Releasee, having been inherited intestate (without a will) from their father, Late Narayana Reddy, who died on August 12, 2010. Joint Status: They are co-parceners (joint legal heirs) of the property. Reason for Release: The parties are unable to enjoy the property jointly, and the land is incapable of physical division (metes and bounds) for separate convenient enjoyment. The Act of Release Release of Share: The Releasor, Sri. Ramesh Reddy, has decided to release, renounce, relinquish, and disclaim his 50% joint right, title and interest in the property. Consideration: The Releasor has not taken any monetary consideration from the Releasee for this transfer, and this is formally acknowledged in the deed. Effect: The Releasee, Sri. Suresh Reddy, shall henceforth hold and enjoy the entire property as the sole and absolute owner exclusively, without any interruption from the Releasor. Declarations and Assurances The Releasor provides the following assurances regarding the land: No Encumbrance: The Releasor assures that he has not encumbered his 50% joint right and agrees to indemnify the Releasee if any such encumbrance is later found. Mutation: The Releasor agrees to co-operate with the Releasee to have the property mutated (ownership recorded) exclusively in the Releasee's name in the revenue records. Compliance with Land Laws: The land is not affected by the A.P. Land Reforms (Ceiling on Agricultural Holdings) Act, 1973. The land is not an assigned land under the A.P. Assigned Lands (Prohibition of Transfers) Act, 1977. Condition of Land: There is no house or construction on the land, nor are there any high-value agricultural assets like Mango Trees, Mines, or Fish Ponds. Co-Owners: There are no other co-owners to the property besides the Releasor and the Releasee.

text: This Deed of simple mortgage executed on 13 day of August, 2021 at 11:00 a.m. by Rohit Khurrana, s/o- Rakesh Khurrana, r/o- Ahiron, Jangipur (hereinafter referred as Mortgagor) in favour of Sudhir Roy, s/o- Rahul Roy, r/o- Umanpur, Murshidabad (hereinafter referred as Mortgagee), the term Mortgagor and Mortgagee meaning and including his heirs, executors, administrators and legal representatives and assigns witnesseth as follows: Whereas the mortgagor is the absolute owner of the property fully described in the schedule hereto. Whereas the mortgagor is in urgent need of funds in order to admit her daughter at a Private Medical College, whereas the mortgagor approached the mortgagee for a loan of Rs. 7 lakhs, whereas the mortgagee has consented for the same. Now this deed of first simple mortgage witnessed that in consideration of the premises and in further consideration of the sum of Rs. 7 lakhs paid by the mortgagee to the mortgagor, the receipt of which sum in manner aforesaid the mortgagor do hereby acknowledge, the mortgagor do hereby transfer, convey and assign unto the mortgagee as and by way of first simple mortgage, all property described in the schedule hereto subject to the following terms and conditions: To repay the Principal sum on demand. In the meanwhile, to pay interest @12% per annum. In the event of death of the mortgagor failing to pay the principal sum and interest or amount due under the mortgage on demand, the mortgagee shall have right of sue for recovery of the said amount and if needed to have the property sold in the said proceeding for the due realisation of mortgage dues. During the subsistence of the mortgage, the mortgagor shall pay all public dues and taxes accruing due in respect of the mortgage property and shall not allow the same to be proceeded against for recovery such dues and taxes. If the mortgagee has to spend money to save the property from being sold for the recovery of said dues, such money shall be deemed and treated as Principal amount, and recovered as such. During the subsistence of the mortgage, the mortgagor shall keep the property mortgaged in good condition and shall not commit any act which is destructive or injurious thereto as to cause the security to become insufficient. The mortgagor doth assure the mortgagee that save the mortgage in favour of Mortgagee to secure a sum of Rs. 7 lakhs under deed of first simple mortgage, Dated 13/08/2021 and there are now no other encumbrances subsisting on the mortgage property. The mortgagor doth also assure the mortgagee that he shall continue to pay the interest due on the first mortgage without any default and shall not render any act, deed or anything whereby the mortgage property will become insufficient security. WITNESSES Mr. Shivin Narang, s/o – Ravindra Narang, age – 34 years, r/o – Jangipur Mr. Rohan Raaj, s/o – Prakash Raaj, age – 38 years, r/o – Jangipur Mortgagor Mortgagee
summary: This document is a Deed of Simple Mortgage executed on August 13, 2021, between two individuals concerning a loan secured by property. Parties and Loan Details MORTGAGOR (Borrower): Rohit Khurrana, the absolute owner of the property. MORTGAGEE (Lender): Sudhir Roy. Loan Purpose: The Mortgagor needed funds to admit his daughter to a Private Medical College. Principal Loan Amount: ?7,00,000 (Rupees Seven Lakhs only). The Mortgagor acknowledges receipt of this amount. Security: The property fully described in the Schedule is transferred to the Mortgagee as a First Simple Mortgage. Terms of Repayment and Interest Repayment of Principal: The Mortgagor must repay the principal sum on demand by the Mortgagee. Interest Rate: The Mortgagor must pay interest at 12% per annum in the meanwhile (until the principal is demanded and paid). Rights and Obligations Mortgagor's Obligations (Borrower) Public Dues: The Mortgagor must pay all public dues and taxes on the property and prevent it from being seized or sold for recovery of such dues. Maintenance: The Mortgagor must keep the mortgaged property in good condition and not commit any act that would damage it or make the security insufficient. No Other Encumbrances: The Mortgagor assures the Mortgagee that there are no other encumbrances (claims or mortgages) subsisting on the property other than this First Simple Mortgage. Interest Payment: The Mortgagor assures that he will continue to pay the interest on time and not do anything that would make the property insufficient security for the loan. Mortgagee's Rights (Lender) Failure to Pay: If the Mortgagor (or his estate, in the event of his death) fails to pay the principal, interest, or any amount due upon demand, the Mortgagee has the right to sue for recovery of the amount. Sale of Property: The Mortgagee has the right to have the property sold in the legal proceeding for the due realization of the mortgage dues. Payment of Dues: If the Mortgagee has to spend money to save the property from being sold for recovery of public taxes/dues, that spent amount will be treated as part of the Principal loan amount and recovered as such. Nature of Mortgage This is confirmed as a First Simple Mortgage, meaning the possession of the property remains with the Mortgagor, but the Mortgagee has the right to seek a court order for the sale of the property if the debt is not paid.

text: AFFIDAVIT (Specimen) (To be notarized by local notary public) I, Mr. Rohan Mehta, Son of Mr. Suresh Mehta, presently residing at 2450 W Addison Street, Apartment 2B, Chicago, Illinois, USA – 60618, and permanent resident of Flat No. 12, Shanti Enclave, Andheri (East), Mumbai – 400059, Maharashtra, India, holder of Indian Passport No. Z4589321 issued at Mumbai on 15th June 2018, hereby solemnly affirm that: Mr. Arjun Patel, S/o Mr. Rajesh Patel, is known to me for the last 10 (ten) years. He is a citizen of India. He has not acquired the citizenship of any other country. He has not been involved in any anti-national activities and bears a good moral character. To the best of my knowledge, no criminal case is pending against him in the USA. Signature: (Signed) Rohan Mehta (Deponent) Place: Chicago, Illinois, USA Date: 29th October 2025 Signed and sworn before me on this 29th day of October, 2025, by Mr. Rohan Mehta. NOTARY PUBLIC State of Illinois My Commission Expires: ____________ (Seal & Signature) Note: To be accompanied by copies of the passport of the deponent (Rohan Mehta) and the individual known (Arjun Patel).
summary: This document is a formal Affidavit (a sworn written statement) executed by Mr. Rohan Mehta (the Deponent) in Chicago, Illinois, USA, on October 29, 2025. Deponent's Identity: Deponent: Mr. Rohan Mehta, S/o Mr. Suresh Mehta. Current Address: 2450 W Addison Street, Apartment 2B, Chicago, Illinois, USA. Permanent Address (India): Flat No. 12, Shanti Enclave, Andheri (East), Mumbai. Passport Details: Indian Passport No. Z4589321, issued at Mumbai on June 15, 2018. Statement Concerning the Known Individual: Mr. Rohan Mehta is making a formal sworn statement regarding Mr. Arjun Patel (S/o Mr. Rajesh Patel). The Deponent solemnly affirms the following facts about Mr. Arjun Patel: Duration of Acquaintance: Mr. Arjun Patel has been known to the Deponent for the last ten (10) years. Citizenship: He is a citizen of India. Other Citizenship: He has not acquired the citizenship of any other country. Character and Activities: He has not been involved in any anti-national activities. He bears a good moral character. Criminal Record: To the best of the Deponent’s knowledge, no criminal case is pending against him in the USA. Execution and Notarization: Execution Date: October 29, 2025. Attestation: The affidavit must be signed and sworn before a Notary Public in the State of Illinois, USA, who attests to the identity and oath of the Deponent and affixes their seal. Mandatory Attachments: The affidavit must be accompanied by copies of the passports of both the Deponent (Rohan Mehta) and the individual known (Arjun Patel).

text: Madras High Court A.Selvam Anandaraj vs / on 24 February, 2026 WP.Nos.2902 & 29916 of 2018 IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT MADRAS DATED : 24.02.2026 CORAM THE HONOURABLE MS. JUSTICE R.N.MANJULA W.P Nos.2902 & 29916 of 2018 A.Selvam Anandaraj, Upper Division Clerk (Retired) Puducherry Municipality, No.4, Drowbathi Street, Kennendy Garden, Sami Pillaithottam, Lawspet, Puducherry-8. ... Petitioner in WP.2902/2018 V.Kuppusamy, Upper Division Clerk (Retired) Puducherry Municipality, No.19/A, Antoniar Koil Street, Muthialpet, Puducherry-3 ... Petitioner in WP.29916/2018 /vs/ 1) The Commissioner, Puducherry Municipality, Puducherry 605 001. 2) The Director, Local Administration Department, Puducherry 605 001. ... Respondents in both WPs. Writ Petitions are filed under Article 226 of the Constitution of India to issue a writ of mandamus directing the respondents to promote notionally the petitioners to the post of Assistant with effect from 22.12.2006. The date on which the Octrori Barrier Operators were promoted and to pass such further or other orders as may be deemed fit and proper in the circumstances of the case. In both WPs., For Petitioner : Mr.P.Suresh For Respondents : Mr.M.Nirmalkumar, Government Advocate (Pondicherry) COMMON ORDER These Writ Petitions have been filed seeking a writ of mandamus to direct the respondents to grant notional promotion to the petitioners to the post of Assistant with effect from 22.12.2006 from the date on which Octroi Barrier Operators were promoted. 2.Heard Mr.P.Suresh, learned counsel for the petitioner, and Mr.M.Nirmalkumar, learned Government Advocate (Pondicherry) for the respondents and perused the materials available on record. 3. The petitioners who were joined as clerks on a daily wages basis with effect from 16.03.1987 have been absorbed into the regular establishment in the post of junior assistant on 20.04.1990. The petitioners were given with an upgradation under the Assured Career Progression Scheme in view of the delay caused for getting the promotion to the next level. The petitioners were given with an actual promotion in the post of senior assistant with effect from 22.12.2006. 4. As the petitioners were already granted with the financial upgradation, they were not given with any monetary benefit during their actual promotion. In the year 2007, the posts of junior assistant and senior assistant were re-designated as Lower Division Clerk and Upper Division Clerk respectively. 18 new posts of assistant [Group-B-Selection post] were also created, but they were not filled up. No recruitment rules for filling up the above posts were also published. The 1st respondent published the seniority list of Upper Division Clerks on 28.10.2010. 5. In the meanwhile, the persons working as 'Octroi Barrier Operators' were rendered surplus in view of the abolition of Octroi in the Union Territory of Puducherry. As they have been deployed and accommodated in the post of Lower Division Clerk, a revised seniority list was published on 07.11.2014, and thereafter the respondents filled up 18 vacant posts by promoting Octroi Barrier Operators, and they were given with a retrospective promotion to the post of Upper Division Clerk. The petitioner in W.P.No.2902/2018 retired from service on 31.07.2015, and the petitioner in WP.No.29916/2018 retired from service on 31.10.2014. The failure to initiate timely action to consider the petitioners promotion has affected them adversely. On 20.12.2006, when retrospective promotions were given to Octroi Barrier Operators, the petitioners were in constructive service, but they were not considered for promotion. 6. The learned Government Advocate (Pondicherry) for the respondents submitted that the petitioners have been promoted to the post of senior assistant only on an adhoc basis with effect from 22.12.2006. Both the petitioners were not entitled to grant the Assured Career Progression Scheme for further fixation of pay and on promotion to the senior assistant on the revised scale of pay on par with the other senior assistants. Because they did not pass the required departmental test. They failed to complete the departmental test till their retirement. Hence they were not considered for further grant of ACP or promotion to any higher post in Pondicherry Municipality. 7. The learned Government Advocate (Pondicherry) for the respondents further submitted that with regard to 18 posts created at the assistant level, for which the method of filing up of those posts, the rules of recruitment have been framed according to which 60% are by promotion, failing which by Limited Departmental Competitive Examinations and failing both by direct recruitment; 20% are by Limited Departmental Competitive Examinations, failing which by promotion, and failing both by direct recruitment; and 20% are by direct recruitment through open competition. 8. The panel containing 23 eligible candidates was placed before the Departmental Promotion Committee, which was duly constituted on 20.07.2016 for selection to the post of Assistant. After due scrutiny, the Departmental Promotion Committee recommended 22 candidates for promotion based on merit. As the petitioners had already retired, they did not come within the ambit of selection. 9. The only grievance of the petitioners is that the promotions were not done in a fixed time limit and that had caused the loss of promotional avenues to the petitioners. The petitioners were promoted in the year 2016 to the post of senior assistant. Before that they were given with the upgradation pay. So for as the next level promotion that was open to the petitioners, it was to the post of assistants. The 18 posts that had been created in the cadre of assistants were not filled up at the time when the petitioners were in service. 10. For the reasons best known to the respondents, there was a delay in recruiting/promoting persons to the post of assistants. Just because any policy decision is taken at a later point of time to expedite the promotion or to do recruitment after a person retires from service, the retired person cannot claim that they would have been given with the promotion if timely action is taken and hence the benefit should be given to them with retrospective effect. 11. Time and again the position of law on this aspect has been reiterated that no one can claim promotion as a matter of right, though it is an indispensable post if any ones career. If the promotions were given as and when due it could have been appreciated. For the reasons best known to the respondents, promotions are withheld for a very long time, and during this period, a person who attained the age of superannuation got retired from service. 12. The entire exercise cannot be done once again by presuming that the retired persons are still in service. The petitioners have approached the Court after their retirement and that too after 18 years. The petitioners did not have any explanation for justifying the delay and latches on their part. No fancy claim for promotion subsequent to retirement can be considered unless for any extraneous reasons. 13. The delay in giving promotion to the post of assistant not only affected the petitioners but also persons similar to them who had been in service during the relevant point of time. Even the petitioners had required to what was given or denied to them while they were in service. Matters which had been given a go-by if opened all of a sudden unmindful of the impractical and endless consequences, will create complex situations which may be worse than the issue at hand. The petitioners could not justify the delay and latches which directly hit their case. In the result, these writ petitions are dismissed. There shall be no order as to costs. 24.02.2025 Index : Yes Internet : Yes/No Neutral: Yes/No Speaking: Non Speaking order jrs R.N.MANJULA, J. jrs To 1) The Commissioner, Puducherry Municipality, Puducherry 605 001. 2) The Director, Local Administration Department, Puducherry 605 001.
summary: This document is a judgment delivered by the Madras High Court (Justice R.N. Manjula) on February 24, 2026, dismissing two writ petitions filed by retired employees of the Puducherry Municipality, A. Selvam Anandaraj and V. Kuppusamy. The petitioners sought a court direction to grant them notional promotion to the post of Assistant, effective retrospectively from December 22, 2006, the date when other surplus employees (Octroi Barrier Operators) were promoted. The petitioners, who had retired in 2014 and 2015, argued that the Municipality's failure to initiate timely action to fill 18 newly created Assistant posts adversely affected their career progression, especially since other employees received retrospective promotions. The respondents (Puducherry Municipality) countered that the petitioners were ineligible for further promotion because they had failed to pass the required departmental tests until their retirement. The Municipality further explained that the selection process for the Assistant posts was only completed in 2016, after the petitioners had already retired, placing them outside the pool of eligible candidates. The Court dismissed the petitions, affirming several principles of service law. The judge stated that promotion cannot be claimed as a matter of right. Crucially, the Court held that a retired person cannot claim a fancy claim for promotion subsequent to retirement with retrospective effect simply because the employer delayed the promotional exercise. The court pointed out that the petitioners were guilty of significant delay and laches, having approached the court years after their retirement and after the alleged cause of action (the delay in promotion) had occurred. The judge concluded that re-opening matters that have been given a go-by creates complex and endless situations, and since the petitioners could not justify their long delay, their writ petitions were dismissed.

text: EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT This EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT (Hereinafter, the "Agreement") is entered into on this 15th day of February, 2025 ("Effective Date") BY AND BETWEEN DataMinds Global LLP, a Limited Liability Partnership registered under the LLP Act, 2008, having LLP ID AAC-9012 with its registered office at Unit 802, The Summit, Worli, Mumbai - 400018 (hereinafter referred to as the "Company" or "Employer", which expression shall, unless repugnant to the meaning or context hereof, be deemed to mean and include all permitted successors and assigns) AND Ms. Neha Sinha, daughter of Mr. Arun Sinha, aged about 29 years, and residing at B-56, Sector 49, Noida, Uttar Pradesh - 201301 (hereinafter referred to as the "Employee", which expression shall, unless repugnant to the meaning or context hereof, be deemed to mean and include all permitted successors and assigns). The Company and the Employee shall hereinafter be individually referred to as "Party" and collectively referred to as "Parties". WHEREAS: A. The Company is engaged in the business of Data Analytics and Business Intelligence Consulting ("Business"). B. The position is designated as Remote/Hybrid, allowing the Employee to primarily work from their residence. NOW, THEREFORE, IN CONSIDERATION OF THE MUTUAL COVENANTS AND AGREEMENTS CONTAINED HEREIN, THE PARTIES AGREE AS FOLLOWS: 1. POSITION AND DUTIES 1.1 The Company hereby appoints Ms. Neha Sinha as a Permanent Full-Time Employee in the capacity of Data Analyst, reporting to the Lead Data Scientist. 1.2 The Employee shall perform duties as outlined in Annexure A (Job Description) and abide by all Company policies and codes of conduct. 2. PLACE OF EMPLOYMENT AND REMOTE WORK POLICY 2.1 The Employee is hired for a Remote/Hybrid role. The base location remains the Mumbai office for statutory purposes, but the Primary Working Location shall be the Employee's residential address in Noida (declared above). 2.2 The Employee must ensure a suitable, safe, and secure home working environment and maintain reliable internet and power backup at the Primary Working Location. 2.3 The Employee is required to attend the Mumbai office or any designated project location for meetings, training, or projects for a minimum of 2 days per month or as reasonably requested by the Company, with travel and accommodation being reimbursed as per Company Travel Policy. 3. TERM AND PROBATION 3.1 The employment is for an indefinite term. 3.2 The first Four (4) months shall constitute a probationary period, during which the notice period shall be 15 days. 4. REMUNERATION AND COMPENSATION 4.1 The Employee shall be paid an annual Cost to Company (CTC) of INR 9,00,000/- (Rupees Nine Lakh Only), payable monthly. 4.2 This CTC includes a specific Remote Work Allowance of INR 3,000 per month, which covers home office-related expenses (internet, utility costs). 5. TERMINATION AND NOTICE 5.1 Termination by Either Party (Post-Confirmation): This Agreement may be terminated by either Party by giving Sixty (60) days' prior written notice. 5.2 The Company reserves the right to enforce Garden Leave (Employee remains employed but does not work) during the notice period. 6. CONFIDENTIALITY AND DATA SECURITY 6.1 The Employee agrees to strictly adhere to the Company's Data Security Policy, including using VPNs, secure passwords, and dedicated work equipment, especially when working remotely. 6.2 The Employee is strictly prohibited from downloading, printing, or transferring Confidential Information onto personal devices or unsecured networks. 7. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION 7.1 This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of India. 7.2 The courts in Mumbai shall have exclusive jurisdiction. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Agreement effective as of the date and year first written above. For DataMinds Global LLP (Signature of Authorized Signatory) Name: Mr. Ajay Menon Designation: Chief Operating Officer For Employee (Signature) Name: Neha Sinha Date: 15th February, 2025
summary: The agreement details the permanent, full-time employment of Ms. Neha Sinha as a Data Analyst by DataMinds Global LLP, effective February 15, 2025. The role is designated as Remote/Hybrid, with the primary working location being the employee's residence in Noida, though the statutory base remains Mumbai. Ms. Sinha will receive an annual Cost to Company (CTC) of INR 9,00,000/-, which includes a specific Remote Work Allowance of INR 3,000/- per month to cover home office expenses. The agreement specifies a four-month probationary period with a 15-day notice clause. After confirmation, either party can terminate the agreement by providing sixty (60) days' written notice, with the Company reserving the right to enforce Garden Leave. A major focus of this contract is Confidentiality and Data Security, requiring strict adherence to company policies, mandatory use of secure tools like VPNs, and an express prohibition against downloading confidential data onto personal devices due to the remote nature of the work. The agreement is governed by the laws of India, with exclusive jurisdiction resting with the courts in Mumbai.

text: LOAN AGREEMENT (Rupee Term Loan Facility) THIS AGREEMENT is executed on this 29th day of October, 2025, at Bengaluru, Karnataka, BY AND BETWEEN: PART I: THE SCHEDULE (Key Commercial Terms) Item No. Description Details / Particulars (Filled-in Information) 1. The Lender HDFC Bank Limited (Commercial Lending Division), having its Corporate Office at [Address of Corporate Office, Mumbai, India]. 2. The Borrower TechNova Solutions Private Limited, a company incorporated under the Companies Act, 2013, having its Registered Office at Unit 501, 5th Floor, Corporate Park, MG Road, Bengaluru, Karnataka – 560001. 3. The Facility (Loan) Rupee Term Loan (RTL). 4. Loan Amount ? 5,00,00,000/- (Rupees Five Crores Only). 5. Purpose of Loan To finance the acquisition of new plant & machinery and renovation of the manufacturing unit. 6. Interest Rate Repo Linked Lending Rate (RLLR) + 3.50% p.a. (Floating). Current Effective Rate: 11.50% p.a. 7. Interest Compounding Monthly Rests. 8. Loan Tenure 7 (Seven) Years from the date of first disbursement. 9. Repayment Schedule 84 (Eighty-Four) Equated Monthly Instalments (EMIs) of Principal and Interest. 10. Moratorium Period 6 (Six) Months from the date of first disbursement (Interest payable monthly during moratorium). 11. Security (Collateral) Primary Security: First Pari Passu charge on all movable assets (present and future), including the new plant & machinery purchased through the loan. Collateral Security: Exclusive charge on the industrial property owned by the Borrower at Peenya Industrial Area, Bengaluru, valued at ? 8,00,00,000/-. 12. Processing Fee 1.5% of the Loan Amount + applicable GST. 13. Prepayment Charges 2.00% of the principal amount prepaid, if prepaid before 2 years. NIL thereafter. 14. Default Interest 2.00% p.a. over and above the Applicable Interest Rate, calculated from the date of default until cured. PART II: OPERATIVE PROVISIONS 1. DEFINITIONS AND INTERPRETATION In this Agreement, unless the context otherwise requires: “Drawdown Date” means the date on which the Lender makes the first disbursement of the Facility. “Facility Documents” means this Agreement, the Promissory Note, Deed of Hypothecation, Deed of Guarantee (if any), and all other documents executed in connection with the Facility. “Material Adverse Effect (MAE)” means a material adverse effect on the Borrower’s business, operations, property, financial condition, or ability to perform obligations under the Facility Documents. “Security” means the Primary and Collateral Security specified in Item 11 of the Schedule. “Secured Property” collectively refers to all assets forming part of the Security. 2. CONDITIONS PRECEDENT TO DISBURSEMENT The Lender shall be obliged to make the first disbursement only after the Borrower has complied with the following conditions to the Lender’s satisfaction: 2.1 Executed Documentation: This Agreement, the Promissory Note, Deed of Hypothecation, and original title deeds for the Collateral Security have been executed and delivered. 2.2 Legal Opinion: Submission of a valid legal opinion confirming enforceability of the Facility Documents. 2.3 Statutory Clearances: Submission of certified copies of all required Board Resolutions and statutory approvals. 2.4 Payment of Fees: Full payment of the Processing Fee and applicable charges. 2.5 Utilisation Plan: Submission of detailed utilisation plan and relevant invoices for the proposed use of loan proceeds. 3. REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES The Borrower represents and warrants to the Lender that: 3.1 Corporate Status: It is duly incorporated and in good standing under Indian law. 3.2 Authorisation: It has the corporate power and necessary approvals to execute this Agreement. 3.3 No Conflicts: The execution and performance of this Agreement do not contravene any law or existing obligation. 3.4 Litigation: There is no litigation or proceeding pending that may have a Material Adverse Effect. 3.5 Security Title: The Borrower is the absolute owner of the Secured Property, free of encumbrances other than those in favour of the Lender. 4. COVENANTS 4.1 Affirmative Covenants The Borrower shall: (a) Maintain its corporate existence and valid licenses. (b) Maintain the Security, keep the Secured Property adequately insured, and pay all related taxes. (c) Furnish audited annual financials within 180 days of year-end and unaudited quarterly results within 60 days. (d) Permit inspection of its books and Secured Property by the Lender upon reasonable notice. 4.2 Negative Covenants The Borrower shall not: (a) Create any further charge or encumbrance on the Secured Property. (b) Dispose of or transfer substantial assets without the Lender’s prior written consent. (c) Alter its capital structure, corporate name, or objects in a manner adversely affecting the Lender. (d) Use the Loan Amount for any purpose other than as specified in Item 5 of the Schedule. 5. EVENTS OF DEFAULT The Facility shall become immediately due and payable upon the occurrence of any of the following: 5.1 Non-Payment: Failure to pay any EMI, interest, or fee when due. 5.2 Breach of Covenants: Breach of any term or covenant under this Agreement. 5.3 Misrepresentation: Any representation or warranty proving untrue or misleading. 5.4 Cross-Default: Default exceeding ?50,00,000/- under any other borrowing. 5.5 Insolvency/Winding Up: Initiation of insolvency or winding-up proceedings. 5.6 Attachment/Distress: Any attachment on the Secured Property not vacated within 30 days. 5.7 Material Adverse Effect: Any event causing a Material Adverse Effect, in the Lender’s opinion. 6. MISCELLANEOUS 6.1 Governing Law: This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of India. 6.2 Jurisdiction: The parties agree to the exclusive jurisdiction of the Courts of Bengaluru, Karnataka. 6.3 Amendments: Any modification must be in writing and signed by both parties. 6.4 Stamp Duty: The Borrower shall bear all stamp duty, registration, and related expenses. (Note: As per Karnataka Stamp Act, stamp duty on a secured loan agreement is typically ?500–?1,000 for corporate term loans, to be confirmed with the Sub-Registrar.) EXECUTION FOR TECHNOVA SOLUTIONS PRIVATE LIMITED (Borrower) Signature: __________________________ Name: Anil Sharma Designation: Director Date: October 29, 2025 FOR HDFC BANK LIMITED (Lender) Signature: __________________________ Name: Pooja Rao Designation: Chief Manager – Commercial Loans Date: October 29, 2025 Witnesses: ___________________________ (Name & Signature) ___________________________ (Name & Signature)
summary: This loan agreement establishes a Rupee Term Loan (RTL) facility of ?5,00,00,000/- (Five Crores) between HDFC Bank Limited (Lender) and TechNova Solutions Private Limited (Borrower), executed on October 29, 2025, in Bengaluru. The loan's specified Purpose is to finance the acquisition of new plant and machinery and renovation of the manufacturing unit. The Loan Tenure is seven (7) years, repayable in 84 Equated Monthly Instalments (EMIs) following a six (6) month moratorium period, during which interest is due monthly. The interest rate is Floating, based on the Repo Linked Lending Rate (RLLR) plus 3.50% p.a. (Current Effective Rate: 11.50% p.a.), compounded monthly. A Processing Fee of 1.5% of the loan amount is payable upfront. If the borrower prepays the principal amount before two years, a Prepayment Charge of 2.00% applies, becoming NIL thereafter. In the event of default, a Default Interest of 2.00% p.a. over the applicable rate is charged until the default is cured. The facility is heavily secured by two forms of collateral. The Primary Security is a First Pari Passu charge on all the Borrower's movable assets (present and future), including the new machinery. The Collateral Security is an Exclusive charge on the Borrower's industrial property in Peenya Industrial Area, valued at ?8,00,00,000/-. Disbursement is strictly subject to the Borrower satisfying various Conditions Precedent, including executing all Facility Documents, providing a legal opinion, submitting Board Resolutions, paying all fees, and presenting a detailed Utilisation Plan with invoices, ensuring the funds are used only for the stated purpose. The agreement imposes strict ongoing obligations and restrictions through Covenants. Affirmative Covenants require the Borrower to maintain its corporate existence, adequately insure the Secured Property, file detailed annual and quarterly financial results, and permit the Lender to inspect its books and assets. Negative Covenants strictly prohibit the Borrower from creating any further charge or encumbrance on the Secured Property, disposing of substantial assets, or altering its corporate structure without the Lender’s written consent. The entire loan becomes immediately due and payable upon the occurrence of any Event of Default, which includes non-payment, breach of covenants, misrepresentation, a Cross-Default exceeding ?50,00,000/- under any other borrowing, or any event causing a Material Adverse Effect (MAE). The agreement is governed by the laws of India, with exclusive jurisdiction in the Courts of Bengaluru, Karnataka.

text: NON-DISCLOSURE AGREEMENT This Non-Disclosure Agreement (“Agreement”) is made on this 10th day of June, 2024 and is entered into by and between: GreenField AgroTech Pvt. Ltd., a company incorporated under the Companies Act, 2013, having its registered office at Plot No. 12, Agro Park Road, Pune, Maharashtra – 411045 (hereinafter referred to as “Disclosing Party”); AND FarmSense Solutions, a sole proprietorship having its principal place of business at No. 5, Innovation Street, Hinjawadi, Pune, Maharashtra – 411057 (hereinafter referred to as “Receiving Party”). WHEREAS the Parties intend to exchange Confidential Information for the purpose of evaluating a potential commercial collaboration on precision-farming sensors (the “Purpose”); NOW, THEREFORE, the Parties agree as follows: “Confidential Information” includes all non-public technical and business information disclosed by the Disclosing Party to the Receiving Party, whether in written, electronic or oral form (if confirmed in writing within thirty (30) days), including but not limited to prototypes, sensor specifications, firmware, pricing, customer lists and field trial data. The Receiving Party shall (a) maintain the Confidential Information in strict confidence; (b) use it only for the Purpose; and (c) disclose it only to those employees or contractors who need to know and are bound by equivalent confidentiality obligations. Exceptions: Confidential Information does not include information that is publicly available (other than through breach), already rightfully known, independently developed, or lawfully obtained from a third party. Required disclosure: If compelled by law to disclose, the Receiving Party shall, to the extent permitted, notify the Disclosing Party to permit intervention for protective relief. The Receiving Party shall return or destroy all Confidential Information upon request and certify compliance, retaining no copies except as required by law. No transfer of intellectual property or licence is implied by this Agreement. Confidentiality obligations shall continue for three (3) years from the date of disclosure. Governing Law: laws of India. Jurisdiction: Courts at Pune, Maharashtra. IN WITNESS WHEREOF the Parties have executed this Agreement on the date first above written. For and on behalf of GreenField AgroTech Pvt. Ltd. Signature: _______________________ Name: Mr. Sameer Kulkarni Designation: Head – R&D Date: 10/06/2024 For and on behalf of FarmSense Solutions Signature: _______________________ Name: Ms. Richa Patil Designation: Founder & CEO Date: 10/06/2024 WITNESSES: Name: Mr. Dinesh Shinde, Chartered Accountant, Pune — Signature: ___________________ Name: Mrs. Kavita Joshi, Head – Operations, GreenField AgroTech — Signature: ___________________
summary: This Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA), executed on June 10, 2024, between GreenField AgroTech Pvt. Ltd. (Disclosing Party) and FarmSense Solutions (Receiving Party), is for the purpose of evaluating a potential commercial collaboration on precision-farming sensors in Pune. The Confidential Information broadly includes all non-public technical and business data, such as sensor specifications, prototypes, pricing, and field trial data, and if disclosed orally, must be confirmed in writing within thirty days. The Receiving Party is obligated to maintain this information in strict confidence, use it only for the specified Purpose, and restrict disclosure internally to personnel who are bound by equivalent confidentiality duties. Crucially, the confidentiality obligations will remain in effect for a fixed term of three (3) years from the date of disclosure. Upon request, the Receiving Party must return or destroy all Confidential Information and certify compliance, acknowledging that no transfer of Intellectual Property or license is implied by the agreement. The agreement is governed by the laws of India, with exclusive jurisdiction resting with the Courts at Pune, Maharashtra.

text: [Non-Judicial Stamp Paper of Rs. 10/-] I, Rohit Mehta, 19 (age) S/o Mr. Rajesh Mehta, Date of Birth 15/08/2003 (DD/MM/YYYY), resident of Flat No. 102, Shanti Apartments, 12 Park Street, Indore, Madhya Pradesh - 452001, do hereby solemnly sincerely affirm and declare under oath as under: That, I have applied for admission in B.Tech in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at IIT Indore located at Khandwa Road, Simrol, 453552, Madhya Pradesh after having fulfilled all the eligibility criteria under the terms of required Minimum Educational Qualification (MEQ) and Qualifying Exam (QE) for Academic Year 2021-22 (Autumn Semester). That, I have applied vide application reference no/JEE (Adv.) Roll No. 12345678 dated 25/07/2021 and have paid the requisite seat acceptance fee amounting to INR. 35,000/- (Thirty Five Thousand Only) vide transaction ID/ref. no. TXN987654321 dated 26/07/2021. That, due to unprecedented situation created by COVID 19 pandemic, I am fully aware of the fact that, I am unable to physically produce and submit my original certificates, documents and testimonials concerning the admission application to the Institute in support of my claim for meeting and clearing the eligibility criteria under MEQ, QE, Caste/Category Certificate, Income Certificate etc. However, at the time of making the requisite application for registration to the Institute, I clearly affirm and declare that all the self-attested copies in lieu of the original certificates, documents and testimonials submitted online to designated e-mail address/e-platform of the Institute are absolutely genuine, authentic and valid. I further confirm that all the copies of aforesaid documents, certificates etc have been duly issued and generated by the recognized/authorized institutions/departments concerned. That, in the event at any time after execution of this Affidavit, it is revealed or discovered by the Institute that relevant copies of the certificates/testimonials in lieu of the originals submitted online to the Institute, are found to be invalid and/or forged, the Institute reserves the right to take any disciplinary action including termination of my admission application with immediate effect and/or any other action as may deem fit to the Institute. That all the particulars and declarations made hereinabove by myself, are true and correct to my knowledge and belief, and nothing has been concealed, misrepresented or false of any fact therefrom. Signature of the Deponent (Rohit Mehta) (Signature and Stamp of the authorized Notary) Name of the Applicant: Rohit Mehta Date: 28th July, 2021 Place: Indore Witnesses along with their signatures and date: (Amit Sharma) 28/07/2021 (Priya Verma) 28/07/2021
summary: This document is a formal Affidavit (sworn declaration) executed by Mr. Rohit Mehta on July 28, 2021, in Indore, Madhya Pradesh. Deponent's Identity and Application Details Deponent: Mr. Rohit Mehta (age 19), S/o Mr. Rajesh Mehta. Residence: Flat No. 102, Shanti Apartments, 12 Park Street, Indore, MP. Application Purpose: Admission in the B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering program at IIT Indore for the Academic Year 2021-22 (Autumn Semester). Application Reference: JEE (Adv.) Roll No. 12345678 (Dated July 25, 2021). Fee Paid: Seat acceptance fee of INR 35,000/- (Thirty Five Thousand Only).
