text: RENTAL AGREEMENT This RENTAL AGREEMENT is made and executed on this 15th day of October, 2024, at Mumbai. BETWEEN Mr. Rohan Varma, son of Late Mr. Suresh Varma, aged about 45 years, residing at A-402, Lotus Towers, Andheri West, Mumbai 400053, holding Aadhar Card No. 123456789012 and PAN No. ABCDE1234F, hereinafter referred to as the "LESSOR" (which expression shall unless repugnant to the context or meaning thereof mean and include his/her heirs, executors, administrators, and assigns) of the FIRST PART. AND Ms. Anjali Sharma, daughter of Mr. Rajesh Sharma, aged about 28 years, residing at 101, Green Meadows Apartments, Vashi, Navi Mumbai 400703, holding Aadhar Card No. 234567890123 and PAN No. FGHIJ5678K, hereinafter referred to as the "LESSEE" (which expression shall unless repugnant to the context or meaning thereof mean and include his/her heirs, executors, administrators, and assigns) of the SECOND PART. WHEREAS the Lessor is the absolute and lawful owner and is in peaceful possession of the residential property situated at Flat No. 703, The Grand Residency, Powai, Mumbai 400076 (hereinafter referred to as the “SCHEDULE PREMISES”), admeasuring about 1200 sq. ft. AND WHEREAS the Lessee has approached the Lessor to take the said SCHEDULE PREMISES on rent for a fixed period of 11 (Eleven) months for residential purposes only. NOW, THIS AGREEMENT WITNESSETH AS FOLLOWS: TERM: The tenancy shall commence from 01st November 2024 and shall remain in force for a period of 11 months, expiring on 30th September 2025. RENT: The Lessee shall pay a fixed monthly rent of Rs. 35,000/- (Rupees Thirty-Five Thousand Only), payable on or before the 5th day of every calendar month. SECURITY DEPOSIT: The Lessee shall pay an interest-free refundable Security Deposit of Rs. 1,50,000/- (Rupees One Lakh Fifty Thousand Only) to the Lessor. This deposit shall be refunded at the time of vacating the premises, after deducting any damages or outstanding dues. MAINTENANCE/UTILITIES: All utility charges, including electricity, water, and gas charges, shall be borne and paid by the Lessee as per actual consumption. Maintenance charges of Rs. 3,500 per month shall be Excluded in the rent and paid directly to the Society by the Lessee. TERMINATION: Either party shall be entitled to terminate this Agreement by giving a clear Two (2) months’ written notice to the other party. USE OF PREMISES: The Lessee shall use the SCHEDULE PREMISES only for bonafide residential purposes and shall not carry out any illegal or commercial activity. IN WITNESS WHEREOF the parties have executed this Agreement on the day, month, and year first above written. WITNESSES: Ramesh Jadhav Signature: _________________________ Priya Nair Signature: _________________________ LESSOR Signature: _________________________ Name: Mr. Rohan Varma LESSEE Signature: _________________________ Name: Ms. Anjali Sharma
summary: This Rental Agreement, executed on October 15, 2024, in Mumbai, establishes a tenancy for the residential property Flat No. 703, The Grand Residency, Powai (admeasuring 1200 sq. ft.) between Mr. Rohan Varma (Lessor) and Ms. Anjali Sharma (Lessee). The fixed Term of the tenancy is eleven (11) months, commencing on November 1, 2024, and expiring on September 30, 2025. The Rent is fixed at Rs. 35,000/- per month, payable on or before the 5th day of every month, and the Lessee must also pay an interest-free refundable Security Deposit of Rs. 1,50,000/-. All utility charges (electricity, water, gas) are the responsibility of the Lessee, and crucially, the monthly Maintenance charges of Rs. 3,500 are excluded from the rent and must be paid directly by the Lessee to the Society. The agreement grants both parties the right to early Termination by providing a clear two (2) months' written notice to the other party, and the Lessee is strictly restricted to using the premises only for bona fide residential purposes.

text: COMMISSION SALES AGREEMENT This Commission Sales Agreement (“Agreement”) is made on 12th day of October, 2024 (“Effective Date”) BY AND BETWEEN TechSolutions India Private Limited, a company registered under the Companies Act, 2013 having CIN U72900DL2010PTC210345 with its registered office at B-25, First Floor, Nehru Place, New Delhi - 110019, (the “Company”), which expression shall, unless repugnant to the context or meaning thereof, be deemed to mean and include its successors and assigns; AND Mr. Rajesh Kumar, son of Mr. Suresh Kumar, aged about 32 years, with permanent account number ABCPK1234R, residing at H-12, Second Floor, Kalkaji, New Delhi - 110019 (the "Sales Executive") which expression shall, unless repugnant to the context or meaning thereof, be deemed to mean and include its agents, successors and assigns. The Company and the Sales Executive shall thereafter collectively be referred to as the “Parties” and individually as the “Party”. WHEREAS: The Company is engaged in the business of marketing and selling IT Solutions (Hardware & Software). The Sales Executive is desirous of selling the Company's services. The Parties have recorded the terms and conditions of their arrangement in this Agreement. NOW IT IS HEREBY AGREED BY AND BETWEEN THE PARTIES AS FOLLOWS: 1. APPOINTMENT OF SALES EXECUTIVE 1.1 The Company hereby appoints the Sales Executive as an authorized non-exclusive independent representative to procure contracts for services (“Contracts”) for the Company in the Delhi/NCR "Territory". 1.2 The Sales Executive shall be required to devote such time, energy and skill on a regular and consistent basis as is necessary to procure Contracts for the Company in the Territory during the term of this Agreement. 1.3 The Sales Executive shall aim to obtain contracts from those targets that match the criteria detailed in Annex A. The criteria is only indicative of the nature and type of market in which the Company desires that its services be sold and should not be construed as a limitation upon the contracts that can be made by Sales Executive under this Agreement within the designated market. 1.4 The Company may call upon and the Sales Executive shall assist the Company in all services required or requested in connection with Company's business, including, but not limited to, such services of an advisory nature as may be requested from time to time by Company. 2. REMUNERATION AND COMMISSION 2.1 The Sales Executive shall receive a monthly sum amounting to INR 25,000 as Salary (Commission). 2.2 The Salary (Commission) shall be paid out within 30 days of raising the invoice and shall be paid only on fees for services rendered by the Company as per the Contract and shall not include freight, supplies, and other charges incidental to the performance of said services. 2.3 The Sales Executive shall bear any and all costs or expenses incurred by him to perform his obligation under this Agreement, including, but not limited to, vehicle insurance, travel expenses and telephone expenses. 3. TERM AND TERMINATION 3.1 This Agreement shall be valid for a period of 60 days from the Effective Date. 3.2 Each Party may terminate this Agreement by means of a registered letter with advice of receipt, to be sent to the other Party with a notice period of 7 Days. The party terminating this Agreement shall have the option of replacing the notice period, in whole or in part, with compensation for Commission for the number of months' notice involved, calculated on the average Commission paid in the calendar year preceding the communication to the other party of the wish to take up this option. A party may waive the notice received, in whole or in part, and in this case, the party terminating this Agreement shall not be entitled to any compensation in lieu. 3.3 The giving of notice shall not be required in the event of termination of the Agreement for the infringement of contractual obligations. The present contract shall be cancelled automatically in the event of the bankruptcy, arrangement with creditors or any other insolvency procedures, the debarment and disqualification of either of the parties; any criminal cases being registered against the Sales Executive, any judgments against the Sales Executive in civil proceedings that could damage its reputation or prevent the normal running of its business. 3.4 A trial period of 60 Days is provided for, during which time either party may withdraw from the contract by giving 7 Days notice. 4. NON COMPETE During the term of this Agreement or within 2 year(s) after its termination, the Sales Executive shall not provide same or similar services within the Territory to any other person, firm, partnership, corporation or other entity in the same business as the Company. 5. CONFIDENTIALITY Under no circumstances and at no time shall the Sales Executive disclose to any person any of the secrets, methods or systems used by the Company in its business. All customer lists, brochures, reports, and other such information of any nature ("Confidential Information") made available to the Sales Executive by virtue of the Sales Executive's association with the Company shall be held in strict confidence during the term of this Agreement and after its termination. 6. RELATIONS OF PARTIES 6.1 This Agreement shall not create a partnership, joint venture, agency, employer/employee or similar relationship between the Company and the Sales Executive. 6.2 The Sales Executive shall be an independent contractor. The Sales Executive shall not be considered an employee of Company and shall not be entitled to participate in any plan, arrangement or distribution by Company pertaining to or in connection with any pension, stock, bonus, profit sharing or other benefit extended to Company's employees. 6.3 The Sales Executive is not authorized to extend any warranty or guarantee or to make representations or claims with respect to Company's services without express written authorization from Company. 7. OBLIGATIONS OF THE SALES EXECUTIVE 7.1 The Sales Executive covenants and undertakes to promote the sale of Contracts on the basis of the stipulated prices and terms of sale and in accordance with the instructions given by the Company. 7.2 The Sales Executive agrees and undertakes to comply with the instructions of the Company as communicated from time to time, the general directives and the commercial policy of the Company which shall be communicated to the Sales Executive from time to time. 7.3 The Sales Executive shall act independent of the Company and in a completely autonomous manner. The Sales Executive shall not be subordinate to, or employed in any capacity by the Company. 7.4 The Sales Executive shall be required to submit a weekly sales report ("Weekly Sales Report") in the prescribed format. The Company may also request the Sales Executive to and the Sales Executive shall provide any documentation as requested by the Company regarding sales. 7.5 The Sales Executive shall notify the Company on a timely basis with regard to the applicable laws, regulations and other provisions which prescribe norms, standards and specifications that the Contracts are required to comply with. 7.6 The Sales Executive covenants and undertakes to notify the Company in relation to any act of unfair competition or infringement of industrial property rights or intellectual property rights, regarding the Contracts committed by third parties in the Territory and, on request, to provide the Company with assistance for the protection of its rights in the Territory. 8. ASSIGNMENT The rights and duties of the Sales Executive under this Agreement are personal and may not be assigned or delegated without prior written consent of the Company. 9. INDEMNITY 9.1 The Sales Executive shall indemnify and hold the Company harmless of and from any and all claims or liability arising as a result of negligent, intentional or other acts of the Sales Executive. 9.2 The Company shall indemnify and hold the Sales Executive harmless of and from any and all liability attributable solely to the negligent, intentional or other acts of the Company or its employees. 10. DISPUTE RESOLUTION 10.1 This agreement and all transactions contemplated hereby, shall be governed by, construed and enforced in accordance with the laws of India. 10.2 Subject to the above, the appropriate courts in Delhi shall have exclusive jurisdiction in relation to any matter arising out of this Agreement. 11. NOTICE Any notice under this Agreement shall be deemed given on the third business day following the mailing of any such notice, postage paid, to the address set forth above. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Agreement effective as of the date and year first written above. For TechSolutions India Private Limited (Signature of Authorized Signatory) Name: Ms. Priya Sharma Designation: Head Human Resource For Sales Executive (Signature) Name: Rajesh Kumar Date: 12th October, 2024
summary: This is a Commission Sales Agreement, effective October 12, 2024, between TechSolutions India Private Limited (Company) and Mr. Rajesh Kumar (Sales Executive), appointing Mr. Kumar as a non-exclusive independent representative to procure IT solutions contracts within the Delhi/NCR Territory. The agreement is unique in that it is explicitly structured as a contract with an independent contractor, not an employer/employee relationship; the Sales Executive is not entitled to company employee benefits like pension or stock options. The agreement has a short fixed term of 60 days, commencing with a 60-day trial period. The primary form of remuneration is referred to as Salary (Commission), set at a fixed monthly sum of INR 25,000, payable within 30 days of invoicing, and based only on fees for services rendered, excluding incidental charges. Notably, the Sales Executive is required to bear all costs and expenses incurred in performing the obligations, including travel and telephone expenses, reinforcing the independent contractor status. Termination of the agreement requires seven (7) days' notice by registered letter, with the option for the terminating party to pay compensation in lieu of the notice period. Termination can also be automatic upon infringement of contractual obligations, bankruptcy, or if the Sales Executive faces criminal cases or civil judgments that could damage the Company’s reputation. To protect the Company's business interests, the agreement includes a stringent Non-Compete clause that prohibits the Sales Executive from providing similar services to any competitor within the Territory for two years after the termination of the agreement. Furthermore, the Sales Executive is bound by a strict Confidentiality clause and must submit weekly sales reports to the Company. The agreement is governed by the laws of India, with the courts in Delhi holding exclusive jurisdiction over disputes.

text: ?100 NON-JUDICIAL STAMP PAPER GOVERNMENT OF TELANGANA Stamp Duty Paid Vide No. TG-HYD/2025/009854321 Dated: 28th October 2025 Value: Rupees One Hundred Only LOAN AGREEMENT THIS LOAN AGREEMENT (this "Agreement") dated this 28th day of October, 2025 BETWEEN: Mr. Rajesh Kumar, S/o Late R. Narayan, aged about 42 years, residing at H.No. 12-4/7, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad – 500034, Telangana, (hereinafter referred to as “the Lender”) OF THE FIRST PART AND Ms. Priya Sharma, D/o V. K. Sharma, aged about 35 years, residing at Flat No. 402, Green Meadows Apartment, Gachibowli, Hyderabad – 500032, Telangana, (hereinafter referred to as “the Borrower”) OF THE SECOND PART IN CONSIDERATION OF the Lender loaning certain monies (the "Loan") to the Borrower, and the Borrower repaying the Loan to the Lender, the parties agree to keep, perform and fulfil the promises and conditions set out in this Agreement: Loan Amount & Interest The Lender promises to loan ? 5,00,000/- (Rupees Five Lakhs Only) to the Borrower and the Borrower promises to repay this principal amount to the Lender, without interest, beginning on 28 October 2025. Payment This Loan will be repaid in consecutive monthly instalments commencing on 28 October 2025 and continuing on the twenty-eighth of each following month until 28 October 2027, with the balance then owing under this Agreement being paid at that time. At any time while not in default under this Agreement, the Borrower may make lump sum payments or pay the outstanding balance then owing under this Agreement to the Lender without any bonus or penalty. Default Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement, if the Borrower defaults in the performance of any obligation under this Agreement, then the Lender may declare the principal amount owing under this Agreement at that time to be immediately due and payable. Governing Law This Agreement will be construed in accordance with and governed by the laws of the State of Telangana. Costs The Borrower shall be liable for all costs, expenses and expenditures incurred, including, without limitation, the complete legal costs of the Lender incurred by enforcing this Agreement as a result of any default by the Borrower, and such costs will be added to the principal then outstanding and shall be due and payable by the Borrower to the Lender immediately upon demand of the Lender. This Agreement will pass to the benefit of and be binding upon the respective heirs, executors, administrators, successors, and permitted assigns of the Borrower and Lender. The Borrower waives presentment for payment, notice of non-payment, protest, and notice of protest. Amendments This Agreement may only be amended or modified by a written instrument executed by both the Borrower and the Lender. Severability If any term or provision of this Agreement is held by a court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid, void, or unenforceable, such provision shall be reduced in scope only to the extent necessary to render it enforceable, and the remaining provisions shall remain in full force and effect. General Provisions Headings are inserted for convenience only and shall not affect interpretation. Words in the singular include the plural and vice versa. Words referring to the masculine include the feminine and vice versa. Entire Agreement This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties, and there are no further items or provisions, either oral or otherwise. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have duly affixed their signatures on this 28th day of October, 2025. SIGNED, SEALED, AND DELIVERED by the within-named Lender Mr. Rajesh Kumar H.No. 12-4/7, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad – 500034, Telangana. In the presence of: Mr. Suresh Babu H.No. 10-2/19, Jubilee Hills, Hyderabad – 500033, Telangana. (Signature) ______________________ Ms. Neha Reddy Plot No. 45, Kavuri Hills, Madhapur, Hyderabad – 500081, Telangana. (Signature) ______________________ SIGNED, SEALED, AND DELIVERED by the within-named Borrower Ms. Priya Sharma Flat No. 402, Green Meadows Apartment, Gachibowli, Hyderabad – 500032, Telangana. In the presence of: Mr. Anil Mehta Flat No. 7A, Lotus Residency, Kondapur, Hyderabad – 500084, Telangana. (Signature) ______________________ Ms. Ritu Verma 2nd Floor, Raghav Enclave, Madhapur, Hyderabad – 500081, Telangana. (Signature) ______________________
summary: This Loan Agreement, executed on non-judicial stamp paper in Telangana on October 28, 2025, details a personal loan transaction between Mr. Rajesh Kumar (the Lender) and Ms. Priya Sharma (the Borrower). The core of the agreement is the lending of ?5,00,000/- (Rupees Five Lakhs Only) to the Borrower. A unique and significant feature of this contract is that the Loan is to be repaid without any interest to the Lender, suggesting this is a zero-interest, goodwill, or personal arrangement. The repayment schedule mandates the loan be repaid in consecutive monthly instalments starting immediately on the date of execution, October 28, 2025, and continuing monthly until the final payment date of October 28, 2027. This sets the loan's term at exactly two years. Importantly, the Borrower retains the flexibility to make lump sum payments or repay the entire outstanding balance at any time without incurring any bonus or penalty, provided they are not currently in default. The Default clause provides the Lender with a strong remedy: if the Borrower defaults on any obligation, the Lender may immediately declare the entire principal amount owing to be due and payable. The Borrower is also made liable for all legal costs and expenses, including the Lender's complete legal fees, incurred as a result of enforcing the agreement due to the Borrower's default; these costs are immediately added to the outstanding principal. The agreement is governed by the laws of the State of Telangana, and any amendments or modifications must be made via a written instrument executed by both parties.

text: RESIDENTIAL LEASE AGREEMENT DATE: November 1, 2024 PARTIES: This Lease Agreement ("Agreement") is made between ABC Property Management, LLC (hereinafter "Landlord") with a mailing address of 100 Main Street, Suite 200, Anytown, CA 90210 and Sarah Johnson and David Lee (hereinafter collectively "Tenant"). PREMISES: The Landlord leases to the Tenant the residential property located at: 456 Oak Avenue, Apartment 1A Anytown, CA 90210 (hereinafter the "Premises"), which includes 2 bedrooms, 1 bathroom, and the following appliances/amenities: Refrigerator, Dishwasher, Community Laundry Access. LEASE TERM: This Agreement shall commence on November 1, 2024 and shall continue as a fixed-term lease until October 31, 2025. Upon expiration, this Agreement shall automatically convert to a month-to-month tenancy unless otherwise agreed in writing. RENT: The Tenant shall pay the Landlord a monthly rent of $ 2,200 (U.S. Dollars). Rent is due on the 1st day of each month. Payments shall be made to the Landlord at the address in Section 1 or by online portal. SECURITY DEPOSIT: The Tenant shall deposit with the Landlord the sum of $ 2,200 as a Security Deposit. This deposit shall be held by the Landlord for the duration of the Lease and shall be subject to the laws of the State of California. UTILITIES: The Tenant shall be responsible for all utility services and charges, including but not limited to electricity, gas, cable, and internet. The Landlord shall be responsible for Water and Trash. ASSIGNMENT AND SUBLETTING: The Tenant shall not assign this Lease or sublet the Premises or any part thereof without the prior written consent of the Landlord. DEFAULT: If the Tenant fails to pay rent on time or violates any term of this Agreement, the Landlord may terminate this tenancy by giving the notice required by law. GOVERNING LAW: This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the State of California. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Agreement on the date first written above. LANDLORD Signature: _________________________ Printed Name: Alex Chen (Property Manager) Date: 11/01/2024 TENANT 1 Signature: _________________________ Printed Name: Sarah Johnson Date: 11/01/2024 TENANT 2 Signature: _________________________ Printed Name: David Lee Date: 11/01/2024
summary: This Residential Lease Agreement, executed on November 1, 2024, is between ABC Property Management, LLC (Landlord) and Sarah Johnson and David Lee (Tenant) for the residential property 456 Oak Avenue, Apartment 1A, Anytown, CA. The agreement is for a fixed term of twelve (12) months, expiring on October 31, 2025, after which it will automatically convert to a month-to-month tenancy unless a new agreement is reached. The monthly rent is $2,200, due on the 1st day of each month. The Tenant is also required to pay a Security Deposit of $2,200. Regarding Utilities, the Tenant is responsible for all charges (electricity, gas, cable, internet), while the Landlord covers Water and Trash. The Tenant is strictly prohibited from assigning or subletting the Premises without the Landlord's prior written consent, and any default allows the Landlord to terminate the tenancy by giving legally required notice. The entire agreement is governed by the laws of the State of California.

text: ?100 /- e-Stamp Paper Government of Karnataka Certificate No. KAE12345678901234 | Date: 15/09/2024 | Issued by: SHC-Sub Registrar Office, Bengaluru (Urban) Purpose: Partition of Family Property DEED OF PARTITION THIS DEED OF PARTITION made at Bengaluru this 15th day of September, 2024. (1) Sri Raghavendra Rao, S/o Late Narayana Rao, Age 62 years, Occupation Retired Government Officer, Residing at No. 12, Lakshmi Nilaya, Jayanagar 5th Block, Bengaluru – 560041, hereinafter referred to as the Party of the First Part. (2) Sri Suresh Rao, S/o Late Narayana Rao, Age 58 years, Occupation Businessman, Residing at No. 24, Green Meadows, Indiranagar, Bengaluru – 560038, hereinafter referred to as the Party of the Second Part. (3) Sri Venkatesh Rao, S/o Late Narayana Rao, Age 54 years, Occupation Engineer, Residing at No. 8, Raj Residency, Malleshwaram, Bengaluru – 560003, hereinafter referred to as the Party of the Third Part. WHEREAS: (a) The parties hereto are the members and coparceners of their joint and undivided Hindu Family and as such own immovable properties consisting of land and building thereon and situated at Basavanagudi, Bengaluru, more particularly described in Schedule “A” hereunder written, and each of the parties hereto is entitled to a share in the said property. (b) Parties to this partition have thrown their properties described in Schedule “A” into the common hotchpot and declared the same as Joint Family Property. The parties desire to effect a partition of the said properties between themselves as they no longer wish to continue as members and coparceners of their joint family and desire to be separate in food, worship, and estate. The parties have agreed that the said Schedule “A” properties will be divided and partitioned in the following manner: (a) The property described in the First Schedule shall belong to the Party of the First Part exclusively. (b) The property described in the Second Schedule shall belong to the Party of the Second Part exclusively. (c) The property described in the Third Schedule shall belong to the Party of the Third Part exclusively. NOW THIS DEED WITNESSETH AS FOLLOWS: Each of the parties grants and releases all his undivided share, right, title, and interest in the property allotted to the others so that each becomes the sole and absolute owner of the property allotted to him, free from all claims of the others. Each party shall bear all applicable municipal taxes, cesses, and government levies concerning the portion allotted to them. Each party covenants that he has done no act or thing whereby the other is prevented from enjoying or transferring their respective share. Each party agrees to execute and register any further deed required to perfect the title of the other, at the cost of the requesting party. Each party agrees that the other shall enjoy their allotted property peacefully, without obstruction, interference, or disturbance by any of the others or their heirs. The original of this deed shall remain with the Party of the First Part, and the duplicate shall remain with the Party of the Second Part. The title deeds relating to the joint properties, mentioned in the Schedule below, shall remain with the Party of the First Part, who will produce them on demand for legal purposes. SCHEDULE “A” (Details of Undivided Properties Belonging to the Joint Family) Sl. No. Description of the Property Property Standing in the Name of 1 Residential House No. 14, Lakshmi Nilaya, 4th Main, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru – 560004 Late Narayana Rao 2 Agricultural Land, Survey No. 62/3, measuring 1.5 Acres, at Kanakapura Taluk, Ramanagara District Joint Family Property FIRST SCHEDULE (Property allotted to the share of Sri Raghavendra Rao) All that piece and parcel of the Residential House No. 14, Lakshmi Nilaya, 4th Main, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru – 560004, measuring 2,400 sq. ft., together with the building and all appurtenances thereto. SECOND SCHEDULE (Property allotted to the share of Sri Suresh Rao) All that piece and parcel of Agricultural Land, Survey No. 62/3, measuring 1.5 Acres, situated at Kanakapura Taluk, Ramanagara District, with all rights, trees, and easements attached thereto. THIRD SCHEDULE (Property allotted to the share of Sri Venkatesh Rao) All that piece and parcel of Vacant Residential Plot, Site No. 45, measuring 1,200 sq. ft., located at BTM Layout 2nd Stage, Bengaluru – 560076. IN WITNESS WHEREOF the parties hereto have set their hands on this 15th day of September, 2024, at Bengaluru, in the presence of the witnesses mentioned below. WITNESSES: Smt. Lakshmi Narayan, W/o Late Narayana Rao, Residing at Basavanagudi, Bengaluru. Mr. Ramesh Iyer, Advocate, Bengaluru. FIRST PARTY – Sd/- Raghavendra Rao SECOND PARTY – Sd/- Suresh Rao THIRD PARTY – Sd/- Venkatesh Rao
summary: This Deed of Partition, executed on September 15, 2024, in Bengaluru, formally and definitively separates the joint and undivided Hindu Family property among the three coparcener brothers, Sri Raghavendra Rao (First Party), Sri Suresh Rao (Second Party), and Sri Venkatesh Rao (Third Party), as they agreed to divide their estate to become legally separate. The partition allocates specific, absolute ownership over the properties: the First Party receives the Residential House in Basavanagudi, the Second Party receives the Agricultural Land in Kanakapura Taluk, and the Third Party receives the Vacant Residential Plot in BTM Layout 2nd Stage. The crucial Mutual Release clause ensures each brother grants and releases his previous undivided share to the others, making their new holding sole and absolute and free from all claims of the others. Furthermore, the agreement stipulates that each party must bear all future taxes and government levies for their allotted portion, and importantly, the original title documents pertaining to the former joint properties will be kept by the First Party, who is obligated to produce them upon demand for legal purposes.

text: INDIA NON JUDICIAL E-Stamp Certificate No.: MH-ESD-20240214-778899 E-Stamp Date: 14/02/2024 Unique Doc Ref: MH/MUM/2024/02/14/00887766 Purchased By: RAGHAVENDRA SHARMA Document Type: RELEASE DEED FOR SELF-ACQUIRED PROPERTY Consideration / Market Value: Rs. 45,00,000/- Stamp Duty Paid: Rs. 3,15,000/- Registration Fee Paid: Rs. 45,000/- Issued By: Stock Holding Corporation of India Ltd. (SHCIL) Place of Issue: Mumbai, Maharashtra DEED OF RELEASE FOR SELF ACQUIRED PROPERTY This DEED OF RELEASE executed on this the 14th day of February, 2024, by Mr. Raghavendra Sharma, S/o Late K. Srinivas Sharma, aged about 42 years, residing at No. 18, 3rd Cross, Jayanagar 4th Block, Bengaluru – 560011, hereinafter referred to as the RELEASOR, of the One Part; AND IN FAVOUR OF Mr. Sandeep Sharma, S/o Late K. Srinivas Sharma, aged about 38 years, residing at No. 22, 5th Main Road, J.P. Nagar, Bengaluru – 560078, hereinafter referred to as the RELEASEE, of the Other Part. The term RELEASOR and RELEASEE shall mean and include their heirs, executors, legal representatives and assigns. WHEREAS the property measuring an extent of 2,400 sq.ft and building thereon situated at Door No. 18, 3rd Cross, Jayanagar 4th Block, in Survey No. 112/3, within the limits of Bengaluru South Taluk, Bengaluru Urban District, was acquired by Late K. Srinivas Sharma, father of the Releasor and the Releasee herein, by virtue of a Sale Deed dated 10th June 1998, registered as Document No. 4567/1998, Book 1, Volume 243, pages 221 to 238 on the file of the Sub-Registrar, Jayanagar, Bengaluru. WHEREAS the said K. Srinivas Sharma died intestate on 15th March 2020, leaving behind the Releasor and the Releasee as his Class I legal heirs. WHEREAS the property more fully described in the Schedule hereunder written is indivisible, and it has been mutually agreed by the Releasor to release his 50% undivided right, title and interest in the property in favour of the Releasee, and the Releasee has agreed and accepted the same. NOW THIS DEED OF RELEASE WITNESSETH AS FOLLOWS: That the Releasor, out of his own free will and volition, and without receiving any monetary consideration from the Releasee, hereby releases, relinquishes, and forever disclaims all his 50% undivided right, title, interest, and ownership in the property more fully described in the Schedule hereunder, in favour of the Releasee. That the Releasor hereby confirms that henceforth he shall have no claim, demand, or right of any nature whatsoever in respect of the schedule property, and the Releasee shall hereafter enjoy the same absolutely, peacefully, and exclusively, with full ownership and rights of sale, mortgage, lease, gift, or otherwise. That the Releasor covenants and undertakes to execute and register any further documents that may be necessary for better assuring and confirming the title in favour of the Releasee, at the cost and expense of the Releasee. SCHEDULE OF PROPERTY All that piece and parcel of residential property bearing Municipal No. 18, 3rd Cross, Jayanagar 4th Block, Bengaluru – 560011, measuring 2,400 square feet, together with the building constructed thereon and all rights, appurtenances, and easements attached thereto, comprised in Survey No. 112/3, within the limits of Bengaluru South Taluk, bounded as follows: North – 2nd Cross Road South – House of Mr. Gopal Rao East – 5th Main Road West – Property of Mr. Shankar Reddy IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Releasor has hereunto set his hand and signature on the day, month, and year first above written in the presence of the witnesses named below. WITNESSES: Mr. Ramesh Kumar, Advocate, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru. Mrs. Priya Menon, Residing at Jayanagar, Bengaluru. RELEASOR: (Signature) Raghavendra Sharma RELEASEE: (Signature) Sandeep Sharma
summary: This Deed of Release, executed on February 14, 2024, in Mumbai, documents the formal relinquishment of property rights between two brothers, Mr. Raghavendra Sharma (Releasor) and Mr. Sandeep Sharma (Releasee), concerning their deceased father's self-acquired property in Bengaluru, which they inherited as Class I legal heirs. The central point of the deed is that the Releasor, Mr. Raghavendra Sharma, freely and voluntarily releases, relinquishes, and forever disclaims his entire 50% undivided right, title, and interest in the residential property located at Jayanagar 4th Block, Bengaluru, in favour of his brother (the Releasee) without receiving any monetary consideration. This means the Releasee, Mr. Sandeep Sharma, becomes the absolute, exclusive, and peaceful owner with full rights, and the Releasor confirms he shall have no future claim whatsoever on the property, further covenanting to execute any necessary documents to confirm the Releasee's absolute title. The deed was executed on e-stamp paper and registered, with stamp duty of $\text{Rs. 3,15,000}$ and a registration fee of $\text{Rs. 45,000}$ paid on the stated market value of $\text{Rs. 45,00,000}$.

text: INDIA NON JUDICIAL E-Stamp Certificate No.: KA-BLR-ESD-20251028-334455 E-Stamp Date: 28/10/2025 Unique Doc Ref: KA/BLR/2025/10/28/0334455 Purchased By: InnoSense Labs Pvt. Ltd. Document Type: Non-Disclosure Agreement Consideration: Rs. 0/- Stamp Duty Paid: Rs. 200/- Issued By: Stock Holding Corporation of India Ltd. (SHCIL) Place of Issue: Bengaluru, Karnataka NON-DISCLOSURE AGREEMENT This Non-Disclosure Agreement (“Agreement”) is made on this 28th day of October, 2025 and is entered into by and between: InnoSense Labs Pvt. Ltd., a company incorporated under the Companies Act, 2013, having its registered office at No. 88, Electronics City, Phase II, Bengaluru, Karnataka – 560100 (hereinafter referred to as “Party 1”); AND OptiData Analytics LLP, a limited liability partnership registered under the LLP Act, 2008, having its office at Block B, 5th Floor, Cyber Towers, Hitech City, Hyderabad, Telangana – 500081 (hereinafter referred to as “Party 2”). Party 1 and Party 2 are hereinafter collectively referred to as the “Parties” and individually as a “Party”. Wherever the context requires, the Party disclosing confidential information shall be referred to as the “Disclosing Party” and the Party receiving such information shall be referred to as the “Receiving Party”. WHEREAS the Parties intend to evaluate and co-develop an AI-based document classification and summarization prototype (the “Purpose”) and in connection therewith each Party may disclose Confidential Information to the other. NOW THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants contained herein, the Parties agree as follows: “Confidential Information” means all non-public information disclosed by the Disclosing Party to the Receiving Party in any form, including business plans, technical data, prototypes, source code, algorithms, product roadmaps, customer lists, pricing and financial information, and any analyses, summaries or extracts thereof. The Receiving Party shall (a) use Confidential Information solely for the Purpose; (b) restrict disclosure to its employees, consultants or advisors on a need-to-know basis who are bound to maintain confidentiality; and (c) protect Confidential Information with at least the same degree of care it uses to protect its own confidential information but not less than reasonable care. Confidential Information does not include information which (i) is or becomes public through no breach by the Receiving Party; (ii) was lawfully in the Receiving Party’s possession prior to disclosure; (iii) is received from a third party without restriction; or (iv) is independently developed by the Receiving Party without use of the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information. If the Receiving Party is required by law or court order to disclose Confidential Information, it shall promptly notify the Disclosing Party (unless prohibited) and cooperate to seek protective measures. On termination of discussions or on written request, the Receiving Party shall promptly return or destroy all Confidential Information and certify destruction, except one archival copy that may be retained solely for compliance purposes. No licence or transfer of intellectual property is granted by disclosure. All Confidential Information remains the property of the Disclosing Party. The obligations of confidentiality shall survive termination of this Agreement for a period of five (5) years from the date of disclosure. This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of India. The courts at Bengaluru, Karnataka shall have exclusive jurisdiction. Any dispute unresolved amicably shall be referred to arbitration under the Indian Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996, with the seat of arbitration at Bengaluru and proceedings in English. IN WITNESS WHEREOF the Parties have executed this Agreement on the date first above written. For and on behalf of InnoSense Labs Pvt. Ltd. Signature: _______________________ Name: Mr. Vikram Menon Designation: Chief Executive Officer Date: 28/10/2025 For and on behalf of OptiData Analytics LLP Signature: _______________________ Name: Ms. Priya Rao Designation: Managing Partner Date: 28/10/2025 WITNESSES: Name: Mr. S. Krishnamurthy, Advocate, Bangalore — Signature: ___________________ Name: Ms. Neha Gupta, Head–Legal, OptiData Analytics LLP — Signature: ___________________
summary: This Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA), executed on October 28, 2025, between InnoSense Labs Pvt. Ltd. (Bengaluru) and OptiData Analytics LLP (Hyderabad), is a mutual agreement for the purpose of evaluating and co-developing an AI-based document classification and summarization prototype. The scope of Confidential Information is broad, covering technical data, source code, algorithms, business plans, and financial information, which the Receiving Party must protect with at least reasonable care and use solely for the specified Purpose. The key term of the NDA is its survival period, as the confidentiality obligations continue for a substantial five (5) years from the date of disclosure. Upon written request or termination, the Receiving Party must promptly return or destroy all Confidential Information. The agreement explicitly confirms that no intellectual property license is granted by the disclosure. The governing law is that of India, with the courts at Bengaluru, Karnataka, holding exclusive jurisdiction, and any unresolved disputes must be referred to arbitration also seated in Bengaluru.

text: RESIDENTIAL RENTAL AGREEMENT This agreement made at Bengaluru, Karnataka on this 25th day of May, 2024 between Mr. Rajesh Kumar, residing at No. 102, Sunshine Apartments, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka, 560034 hereinafter referred to as the ‘LESSOR’ of the One Part AND Ms. Priya Sharma, residing at Flat No. 5, Green Valley Residency, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka, 560038 hereinafter referred to as the ‘LESSEE’ of the other Part; WHEREAS the Lessor is the lawful owner of, and otherwise well sufficiently entitled to No. 102, Sunshine Apartments, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka, 560034 falling in the category, Apartment and comprising of 2 Bedrooms, 2 Bathrooms, 1 Carpark with an extent of 1100 Square Feet hereinafter referred to as the ‘said premises’;

The agreement pertains to the residential property, Flat No. 102, Sunshine Apartments, Koramangala, Bengaluru, which is a 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom apartment spanning 1100 Square Feet and includes the use of 1 Carpark.

text: THIS DEED OF GIFT is made on this 15th day of October, 2025, at Mumbai, BETWEEN Vithal V. KAMAT, age about 81 years, Indian Inhabitant of Mumbai, residing at Flat No. 001, Ground Floor, Building No. B-4, Satellite Classic CHSL., Caves Road, Jogeshwari (East), Mumbai 400060, hereinafter called and referred to as "THE DONOR" (which expression shall mean and include his heirs, executors, administrators and assigns) of the ONE PART; AND DR.
