However, it is possible to infer from the circumstances of a given case that a lawful relationship is born between the two and such a relationship is recognized under the provisions of Section 70." 27. In the light of the aforesaid reasoning given by the Arbitrator, if we now look into the provision of Section 70 of the Indian Contract Act along with Section 73 thereof, we are left with no doubt in our mind that the reasoning given by the Arbitrator particularly that of invoking Section 70 of the Indian Contract Act for allowing of the few claims raised by respondent No.1 / Contractor to be proper, legal and justified. Section 73 of the Indian Contract Act at the outset disentitles the contractor any amount of compensation for the simple reason that the Arbitrator has reached to a categorical and emphatic finding of fact that there has been no breach of contract on the part of the appellant- Corporation. Nonetheless, the reasons reflected in paragraphs Nos.66, 70 and 71 (supra), would also show that because of certain supplementary agreement certain extra works were also asked to be executed by the respondent No.1/ Contractor. The appellant- Corporation had themselves repeatedly on five occasions granted extension of time, not once have the appellant-Corporation raised its objection on the respondent No.1 / Contractor seeking extension of time. Likewise, not even once had the appellant-Corporation extended time for completion of work invoking the relevant clause for liquidating the damages. 28. It is in this context that the relevance of Section 70 of the Indian Contract Act becomes germane and relevant to the claim put forth by the respondent No.1 / Contractor. Admittedly, the respondent No.1 / Contractor had lawfully
summary: This document is a formal Affidavit (sworn declaration) executed jointly by two parents, Sri Anil Kumar Basu and Smt Mousumi Basu, on December 15, 2023, in Kolkata, West Bengal. Declarants' Identity: Declarants (Parents): Sri Anil Kumar Basu (Husband) and Smt Mousumi Basu (Wife). Residence: 24/B, N.S. Road, Dum Dum, Kolkata. Spousal Status: They affirm that they have no other living spouse besides each other. Child and Educational Details: Child's Name: Ankita Basu. Child's Status: She is their only child and is a female child, born on July 12, 2012. Siblings: The parents affirm that they have no other child in their family besides Ankita Basu. Current Enrollment (2024-25): Studying in Class VII, Section A at Kendriya Vidyalaya Ordnance Factory Dum Dum. Future Enrollment (2025-26): Will continue study in Class VIII at the same school. Purpose and Undertakings: Purpose of Affidavit: To obtain exemption of school fees for the next academic session (2025-26) under the Single Girl Child Scheme. Other Allowances: The parents affirm that neither of them is currently enjoying any benefit of Children Education Allowances from any other source. Notification Undertaking: They undertake to immediately intimate the Kendriya Vidyalaya if another child is born in their family. Penalty Clause: They agree that if any statement in the affidavit proves false at any stage, the school authority is entitled to take appropriate action, including cancellation of the child's admission.

text: Stamp Paper Value?100 NON-JUDICIAL STAMP PAPERGovernmentGOVERNMENT OF MAHARASHTRAStamp Duty Paid Vide No.MH-MUM/2025/112233445Dated20th November 2025ValueRupees One Hundred OnlyLOAN AGREEMENTTHIS LOAN AGREEMENT (this "Agreement") dated this 20th day of November, 2025BETWEEN:Mr. Arjun Mehta,S/o Mr. Suresh Mehta,aged about 38 years,residing at Flat No. 101, Sea View Towers, Bandra West, Mumbai – 400050, Maharashtra,(hereinafter referred to as “the Lender”)OF THE FIRST PARTANDMs. Shanaya Kapoor,D/o Mr. Vijay Kapoor,aged about 30 years,residing at Apartment 302, Galaxy Heights, Andheri East, Mumbai – 400099, Maharashtra,(hereinafter referred to as “the Borrower”)OF THE SECOND PARTLoan Amount & InterestThe Lender promises to loan ? 8,00,000/- (Rupees Eight Lakhs Only) to the Borrower.The Loan shall carry an annual interest rate of 12%, calculated on the reducing principal balance.PaymentThis Loan will be repaid in 36 (thirty-six) consecutive Equated Monthly Instalments (EMIs) of ? 26,600/- (including principal and interest).The monthly instalments shall commence on 20th December 2025 and continue on the twentieth of each following month until the full repayment is complete on 20th November 2028.Governing LawThis Agreement will be construed in accordance with and governed by the laws of the State of Maharashtra.
summary: This Loan Agreement, executed on November 20, 2025, in Maharashtra, formalizes a personal loan of ?8,00,000/- (Rupees Eight Lakhs Only) from Mr. Arjun Mehta (Lender) to Ms. Shanaya Kapoor (Borrower). The loan carries a fixed annual interest rate of 12%, calculated on the reducing principal balance. The total loan tenure is 36 months. Repayment is structured into 36 consecutive Equated Monthly Instalments (EMIs) of ?26,600/- (which includes both principal and interest), commencing on December 20, 2025, and concluding on November 20, 2028. The entire agreement is governed by the laws of the State of Maharashtra.

text: EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT This EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT (Hereinafter, the "Agreement") is entered into on this 10th day of January, 2025 ("Effective Date") BY AND BETWEEN InfraBuild Holdings Private Limited, a company incorporated under the Companies Act, 2013, having CIN U45200DL2005PTC140000 with its registered office at Tower A, DLF Cyber City, Phase III, Gurugram - 122002 (hereinafter referred to as the "Company" or "Employer", which expression shall, unless repugnant to the meaning or context hereof, be deemed to mean and include all permitted successors and assigns) AND Mr. Vivek Goel, son of Mr. Subhash Goel, aged about 55 years, with permanent account number ABCPG5678X, and residing at 1201, Nirvana Country, Sector 50, Gurugram - 122018 (hereinafter referred to as the "Employee", which expression shall, unless repugnant to the meaning or context hereof, be deemed to mean and include all permitted successors and assigns). The Company and the Employee shall hereinafter be individually referred to as "Party" and collectively referred to as "Parties". WHEREAS: A. The Company is engaged in the business of Infrastructure Development and Construction ("Business"). B. The Company wishes to avail of the services of the Employee as a key executive. NOW, THEREFORE, IN CONSIDERATION OF THE MUTUAL COVENANTS AND AGREEMENTS CONTAINED HEREIN, THE PARTIES AGREE AS FOLLOWS: 1. POSITION AND DUTIES 1.1 The Company hereby appoints Mr. Vivek Goel as a Permanent Full-Time Employee in the capacity of Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and Key Managerial Personnel (KMP), reporting directly to the Board of Directors. 1.2 The Employee shall diligently perform all duties consistent with the office of a CFO in a large infrastructure firm, including but not limited to statutory compliance, financial planning, and reporting. 2. TERM OF EMPLOYMENT 2.1 The employment shall commence from the Effective Date and shall be for an indefinite term. 3. PROBATIONARY PERIOD 3.1 No formal probationary period is applicable given the executive nature of the role; however, the initial Ninety (90) days shall be a review period. 4. REMUNERATION AND COMPENSATION 4.1 The Employee shall be paid an annual Cost to Company (CTC) of INR 55,00,000/- (Rupees Fifty-Five Lakh Only), as detailed in Annexure B (Executive Compensation Package). 4.2 In addition to salary, the Employee shall be eligible for an annual performance bonus and stock options as per the Company's ESOP scheme, subject to the achievement of pre-determined targets. 4.3 The Employee shall be entitled to an executive car and driver and a monthly travel allowance of INR 20,000/-. 5. TERMINATION OF EMPLOYMENT 5.1 Termination by Either Party: Following the review period, either Party may terminate this Agreement by providing Ninety (90) days' prior written notice. 5.2 Severance: If the Employee is terminated without cause, the Company shall pay a severance equivalent to three months of the Employee's last drawn basic salary, in addition to the notice period compensation. 6. INDEMNITY 6.1 The Company agrees to indemnify and hold the Employee harmless against any claim, suit, or proceeding arising out of the Employee's good-faith performance of duties as CFO, excluding acts of fraud or gross negligence. 7. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION 7.1 This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of India. 7.2 The appropriate courts in Gurugram, Haryana shall have exclusive jurisdiction. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Agreement effective as of the date and year first written above. For InfraBuild Holdings Private Limited (Signature of Authorized Signatory) Name: Mr. Sanjay Mittal Designation: Chairman of the Board For Employee (Signature) Name: Vivek Goel Date: 10th January, 2025 [STAMP DETAILS] Company Seal: e-Stamp Paper Details: State: Haryana Stamp Duty Paid: INR 300/- (As applicable for high-value agreements) Unique Document ID: IN-HR-03-345678-2025 Date of Purchase: 09/01/2025
summary: This employment agreement, effective January 10, 2025, formalizes the appointment of Mr. Vivek Goel as the Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and Key Managerial Personnel (KMP) at InfraBuild Holdings Private Limited, an infrastructure development and construction firm based in Gurugram. The employment is for a permanent, indefinite term, directly reporting to the Board of Directors. Given the executive nature of the role, there is no formal probation, but an initial 90-day review period applies. Mr. Goel's annual Cost to Company (CTC) is set at INR 55,00,000/- (Fifty-Five Lakh). His executive compensation package includes substantial variable and perquisite benefits: eligibility for an annual performance bonus and stock options via the Company's ESOP scheme, plus an executive car and driver and a monthly travel allowance of INR 20,000/-. Regarding termination, either party must provide Ninety (90) days' written notice following the initial review period. The agreement provides financial protection for the executive: if terminated without cause, Mr. Goel is entitled to a severance payment equivalent to three months of his last drawn basic salary, which is paid in addition to the compensation for the 90-day notice period. Crucially, the Company provides a strong Indemnity clause, agreeing to hold the CFO harmless against any claim or suit arising from his good-faith performance of duties, excluding acts of fraud or gross negligence. The agreement is governed by Indian law, with exclusive jurisdiction assigned to the courts in Gurugram, Haryana.

text: (TO BE ATTESTED BY 1ST CLASS MAGISTRATE/SUB-JUDGE ON NON-JUDICIAL STAMP PAPER OF RS.10/-) Affidavit of Shri Rajesh Kumar Verma Son/ daughter/ wife of Shri Late Harish Chandra Verma R/o H. No. 45, Sector 12, Patel Nagar, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh - 226001 The deponent Solemnly affirms as follows:- That Late Harish Chandra Verma was my Father/Mother /Husband/Wife /Grandfather/Grandmother/Father-in-law and He/ She died on 15th March, 2023. That the deceased was lessee of property No. B-12, Commercial Complex, Hazratganj, Lucknow. That the lease in respect of the said property was registered as No. LKO/LEASE/7845 additional book No. 5 Vol.No. 12 on pages No. 45 to 48 dated 10th January, 2005. That the deceased has left behind the following heirs (Widow/Widower/Mother/ Son/Daughter/Widow of predeceased son/ Children of predeceased daughter/Children of predeceased son etc.) including myself under Hindu Succession Act, and their names along with their relationship with deceased, their ages and their addresses are give below:- S.No. Name Age Relationship Address | Rajesh Kumar Verma | 42 | Son | H. No. 45, Sector 12, Patel Nagar, Lucknow | Sunita Verma | 68 | Wife (Widow) | H. No. 45, Sector 12, Patel Nagar, Lucknow | Priya Singh | 38 | Daughter | D-24, Gomti Nagar, Lucknow | Rohan Verma | 18 | Grandson (Son of predeceased son) | H. No. 45, Sector 12, Patel Nagar, Lucknow That the deceased did not leave behind any other heirs except those whose names are given above. That the deceased left behind a will dated 5th February, 2023 bequeathing the aforesaid property in favour of Rajesh Kumar Verma which is registered/non-registered one. The Will's genuine and I have no objection if the same is acted upon. (or) That the deceased has left behind no Will. DEPONENT Rajesh Kumar Verma VERIFICATION: the above named deponent, do hereby verify that the contents of para 1 to 6 of the above affidavit are true and correct to my knowledge and that no portion is false and that the said affidavit conceals nothing which is relevant to the above matter. Signed, dated and verified at Lucknow this the 25th day of July 2024 DEPONENT Rajesh Kumar Verma NOTES: Attested copy of the Death Certificate(s) should be enclosed. Give also the name of the heirs of the predeceased son/sons and predeceased daughter/daughters of deceased under clause IV above along with the mother, widow, daughter or sons. In case the deceased lessee has left behind Will all heirs should also state in the affidavit that the Will is genuine and they have no objection if the same is acted upon. Affidavits must be as per prescribed format given at back page. If the deceased had left behind an unregistered Will a copy of that will duly attested by Gazetted Officer/Notary Public should be sent along with the affidavits. If it is not possible to obtain/furnish the No Objection affidavits of all legal heirs, the beneficiary/beneficiaries should obtain a probate of the will from a competent court of Law. If the Will is probated, the No Objection affidavits from the legal heirs are not required. However in such cases a Certified copy of probate order along with a copy of the Will should be furnished by the applicant. If any one of the heirs wants to relinquish his/her rights. He/She should execute and get registered Relinquishment Deed in favour of the heirs in whose favour they want to give up their rights. Original or Certified copy of Relinquishment Deed/Release Deed from the Sub-Registrar Office should be submitted with application. All those who execute a relinquishment deed and get it registered need not to give affidavits. Only Releasee have to give their affidavits. Minors, however cannot give up their rights. In case the deceased has left no will and the heirs have not executed Relinquishment Deed then all heirs should give their affidavits. All affidavits should be got attested by 1st class Magistrate/Sub-Judge and given on Non-judicial Stamp Paper of Rs.10/- and the copies of Death Certificate, Will and Power of Attorney may be got attested by any one of the following: - (a) Gazetted Officer. (b) Notary Public (With notarial stamp of Rs.3/-). (c) Member of Parliament. (d) Member of Metropolitan council.
summary: This document is an Affidavit executed by Shri Rajesh Kumar Verma on July 25, 2024, concerning the succession rights to a commercial leasehold property following a death. Declarant's Identity Declarant (Deponent): Shri Rajesh Kumar Verma. Address: H. No. 45, Sector 12, Patel Nagar, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh. Details of the Deceased and Property Deceased: Late Harish Chandra Verma. Relationship: The deceased was the Declarant's Father. Date of Death: March 15, 2023. Property Involved: Leasehold property No. B-12, Commercial Complex, Hazratganj, Lucknow. Lease Details: The original lease was registered on January 10, 2005 (Document No. LKO/LEASE/7845). Legal Heirs of the Deceased The Declarant affirms that the deceased left behind the following legal heirs under the Hindu Succession Act, including the Declarant himself: Rajesh Kumar Verma (Son, age 42, the Declarant). Sunita Verma (Wife/Widow, age 68). Priya Singh (Daughter, age 38). Rohan Verma (Grandson, age 18, Son of a predeceased son). The Declarant asserts that there are no other heirs except those listed above. Succession Status (Will) The Affidavit provides two options regarding a will, and the Declarant has chosen to affirm one: Affirmed Status: The deceased left behind a Will dated February 5, 2023, bequeathing the commercial property in favour of Rajesh Kumar Verma (the Declarant). Heirs' Consent: The Declarant states that the Will is genuine and affirms, in this affidavit, that he has no objection if the Will is acted upon. Mandatory Requirements (Notes) The notes appended to the affidavit outline external requirements: Attestation: The affidavit must be attested by a 1st Class Magistrate/Sub-Judge on Non-judicial stamp paper of ?10/-. Enclosures: An attested copy of the Death Certificate must be enclosed. Probate: If obtaining No Objection affidavits from all legal heirs is not possible, the beneficiary must obtain a Probate of the Will from a competent court. Relinquishment: If any heir wishes to give up their rights, they should execute and register a Relinquishment Deed in favour of the desired beneficiary.

text: LOAN AGREEMENT (Secured Against Mortgage of Property) THIS AGREEMENT is made on this 5th day of January, 2026, at Gurgaon, Haryana. BETWEEN: XYZ Housing Finance Limited, a company incorporated under the Companies Act, 2013, having its registered office at [Address], (hereinafter referred to as the “Lender”, which expression shall, unless repugnant to the context or meaning thereof, include its successors and assigns) OF THE ONE PART, AND Mr. Vijay Saini, S/o Mr. A. Saini, residing at [Address], (hereinafter referred to as the “Borrower”, which expression shall, unless repugnant to the context or meaning thereof, include his heirs, executors, administrators, and assigns) OF THE OTHER PART. WHEREAS: The Borrower has approached the Lender for a loan for personal/residential purposes. The Lender has agreed to grant a loan to the Borrower on the terms and conditions hereinafter set forth. 1. LOAN AMOUNT & SECURITY 1.1 The Lender has sanctioned a loan of ? 40,00,000/- (Rupees Forty Lakhs Only) to the Borrower. 1.2 The Borrower agrees to secure the said Loan by way of a First Mortgage (Equitable or Registered) in favour of the Lender on the immovable property described as follows: Property Details: Flat No. 501, Crystal Residency, Gurgaon, Haryana – 122001 (hereinafter referred to as the “Secured Property”). 2. COVENANTS The Borrower hereby covenants and undertakes that: (a) The Secured Property is and shall remain free from all encumbrances, charges, liens, or third-party interests. (b) The Borrower shall not create any charge, lien, mortgage, or encumbrance on the Secured Property or part with its possession without the prior written consent of the Lender. (c) The Borrower shall maintain the Secured Property in good condition and not alter its structure in any manner that may affect its market value. 3. INSURANCE 3.1 The Borrower shall keep the Secured Property insured against risks such as fire, earthquake, flood, and other natural calamities for its full market value. 3.2 The insurance shall be taken in joint names of the Borrower and the Lender, with the Lender’s interest duly noted on the policy. 3.3 The Borrower shall furnish copies of the insurance policy and renewal receipts to the Lender upon demand. 3.4 In the event the Borrower fails to insure or renew the policy, the Lender may, at its discretion, insure the Secured Property, and all costs so incurred shall be reimbursed by the Borrower on demand and shall form part of the Loan outstanding. 4. DEFAULT If the Borrower commits any default in repayment or breaches any term of this Agreement, the Lender shall be entitled to: (a) Recall the entire Loan and accrued interest with immediate effect; (b) Enforce its rights under the mortgage and take possession or cause sale of the Secured Property as per law. 5. GOVERNING LAW This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of India, and the courts of Gurgaon, Haryana, shall have exclusive jurisdiction. 6. STAMP DUTY & COSTS All stamp duty, registration charges, and legal expenses in connection with this Agreement and the mortgage deed shall be borne and paid by the Borrower. (For Haryana, stamp duty on a loan agreement secured by mortgage is typically ?100 for the agreement and additional duty as per the market value under Section 5 & Article 6 of the Indian Stamp Act, 1899 as amended by Haryana State – to be verified at the local Sub-Registrar’s office.) IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have executed this Agreement on the date first above written. SIGNED AND DELIVERED BY: For XYZ Housing Finance Limited (Signature) __________________________ Authorized Signatory Name: __________________________ Designation: _____________________ In the presence of: __________________________ (Witness) __________________________ (Witness) SIGNED AND DELIVERED BY: Mr. Vijay Saini (Signature) __________________________ Borrower In the presence of: __________________________ (Witness) __________________________ (Witness)
summary: This Secured Loan Agreement, executed on January 5, 2026, in Gurgaon, Haryana, details a loan of ?40,00,000/- (Rupees Forty Lakhs Only) granted by XYZ Housing Finance Limited (Lender) to Mr. Vijay Saini (Borrower) for personal or residential purposes. The loan is explicitly Secured Against Mortgage of Property, requiring the Borrower to create a First Mortgage (Equitable or Registered) over the specified immovable asset, Flat No. 501, Crystal Residency, Gurgaon, designated as the Secured Property. The agreement imposes strict Covenants on the Borrower to protect the collateral: the Secured Property must remain free from all encumbrances and the Borrower must not create any further charge or part with possession without the Lender’s prior written consent. The Borrower also commits to maintaining the property in good condition and avoiding structural alterations that could diminish its market value. A key requirement is the Insurance clause, which mandates the Borrower must insure the Secured Property against risks like fire and natural calamities for its full market value, with the policy taken in the joint names of the Borrower and the Lender, noting the Lender’s interest. If the Borrower fails to insure, the Lender may do so, and the incurred costs are immediately added to the Loan outstanding. The Default clause provides the Lender with powerful remedies: if the Borrower defaults on repayment or breaches any term, the Lender gains the right to Recall the entire Loan with immediate effect and enforce its rights under the mortgage, including taking possession or causing the sale of the Secured Property as per law. All associated stamp duty, registration charges, and legal costs for the agreement and the mortgage deed are the sole responsibility of the Borrower. The agreement is governed by the laws of India, with exclusive jurisdiction vested in the courts of Gurgaon, Haryana.

text: INDIA NON JUDICIAL E-Stamp Certificate No.: KA-BLR-ESD-20240315-998877 E-Stamp Date: 15/03/2024 Unique Doc Ref: KA/BLR/2024/03/15/00245678 Purchased By: TechNova Innovations Pvt. Ltd. Document Type: Non-Disclosure Agreement Consideration Amount: Rs. 0/- Stamp Duty Paid: Rs. 100/- Issued By: Stock Holding Corporation of India Ltd. (SHCIL) Place of Issue: Bengaluru, Karnataka NON-DISCLOSURE AGREEMENT This Non-Disclosure Agreement (“Agreement”) is made on this 15th day of March, 2024, and entered into by and between: TechNova Innovations Pvt. Ltd., a company incorporated under the Companies Act, 2013, having its registered office at #42, Electronic City Phase 1, Bengaluru, Karnataka – 560100 (hereinafter referred to as the “Party 1”); AND Datacore Analytics LLP, a limited liability partnership registered under the LLP Act, 2008, having its office at #110, HITEC City, Hyderabad, Telangana – 500081 (hereinafter referred to as the “Party 2”). Party 1 and Party 2 are hereinafter collectively referred to as the “Parties” and individually as a “Party.” Wherever the context requires, the Party disclosing confidential information shall be referred to as the “Disclosing Party”, and the Party receiving the information shall be referred to as the “Receiving Party.” WHEREAS: A. Party 1 engages in AI-driven software product development, and Party 2 engages in data analytics and predictive modeling services. B. The Parties wish to collaborate and exchange confidential information for joint research and prototype development (“Purpose”) and desire to maintain confidentiality of such shared information. NOW THIS AGREEMENT WITNESSETH AS FOLLOWS: Definition of Confidential Information: Confidential Information shall include all non-public, proprietary, business, financial, and technical data disclosed directly or indirectly by the Disclosing Party to the Receiving Party in any form. Use of Information: The Receiving Party shall use the Confidential Information solely for the Purpose defined herein and not for any other purpose. Disclosure: The Receiving Party shall not disclose any Confidential Information to third parties without prior written consent of the Disclosing Party, except to its employees or advisors who have a need to know. Protection: The Receiving Party shall protect the Confidential Information with the same degree of care as it uses to protect its own confidential information, but in no case less than reasonable care. Exceptions: Confidentiality obligations shall not apply to information that: (a) is already in the public domain; (b) is received from a third party without breach; (c) is independently developed by the Receiving Party; or (d) is required to be disclosed by law or court order. Return or Destruction: Upon termination of discussions or upon request, the Receiving Party shall return or destroy all materials containing Confidential Information. No License: Nothing in this Agreement shall be construed as granting any license or rights under any patent, trademark, or copyright of either Party. Term: This Agreement shall remain valid for a period of three (3) years from the Effective Date, unless extended by mutual written consent. Governing Law: This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of India, and the courts at Bengaluru, Karnataka, shall have exclusive jurisdiction. Entire Agreement: This Agreement constitutes the entire understanding between the Parties concerning the subject matter and supersedes all prior communications or representations. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Agreement on the day, month, and year first above written. Signature Name Designation Organisation (Signed) Ravi Narayan CEO TechNova Innovations Pvt. Ltd. (Signed) Ananya Mehta Managing Partner Datacore Analytics LLP WITNESSES: Mr. Pradeep Shetty, Advocate, Bengaluru. Mrs. Kavitha Rao, Consultant, Hyderabad.
summary: This Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA), executed on March 15, 2024, establishes a mutual confidentiality obligation between TechNova Innovations Pvt. Ltd. (Bengaluru) and Datacore Analytics LLP (Hyderabad) to facilitate joint research and prototype development in AI-driven software and data analytics. The agreement mandates that all non-public technical and business data disclosed must be used solely for the stated Purpose and protected with at least reasonable care. The core term of the NDA is three (3) years from the effective date, after which the obligations cease unless mutually extended in writing. Upon request or termination of discussions, the Receiving Party is obligated to either return or destroy all materials containing Confidential Information. The agreement explicitly clarifies that no license or rights to any intellectual property are granted by the disclosure and is governed by the laws of India, with exclusive jurisdiction assigned to the courts of Bengaluru, Karnataka.

text: Himachal Pradesh High Court Sh. Shankar Dass vs Himachal Pradesh State Electricity ... on 25 October, 2021 Author: Ajay Mohan Goel Bench: Ajay Mohan Goel IN THE HIGH COURT OF HIMACHAL PRADESH, SHIMLA ON THE 25th DAY OF OCTOBER, 2021 BEFORE HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE AJAY MOHAN GOEL CIVIL ORIGINAL PETITION CONTEMPT (TRIBUNAL) No.176 of 2020 Between: SANJEEV KUMAR S/O LATE SH. SHANKAR DASS, VILLAGE -SAKON, P.O.- BALH, TEHSIL BANGANA, DISTRICT-UNA, H.P. 174321. ....PETITIONER. (BY. SHRI ANKUSH DASS SOOD, SENIOR ADVOCATE WITH SHRI RAKESH K. SHARMA, ADVOCATE) AND 1. KUMUD SINGH D/O SH. SHAKTI SINGH, SECRETARY OF HIMACHAL PRADESH STATE ELECTRICITY BOARD VIDYUT BHAVAN SHIMLA. 2. DR. ASHWANI SHARMA, SECRETARY-CUM- EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR OF HPSEBL (IN TERMS OF ORDER DATED 21/7/2020) 3. MANOJ KUMAR, SECRETARY OF RESPONDENT-BOARD (IN TERMS OF ORDER DATED 5/10/2021) ....RESPONDENTS. (BY. SHRI SURINDER SAKLANI, ADVOCATE ) JUDGMENT The petitioner before this Court was appointed as a Junior Engineer (Electrical) with the H.P. State Electricity Board pursuant to Office Order dated 05.08.2011 on contract basis. He approached the learned erstwhile Himachal Pradesh Administrative Tribunal by way of O.A. No.4735 of 2015, titled as Sanjeev Kumar Vs. Himachal Pradesh State Electricity Board & others, vide which Original Application, prayer was made that the employer be directed to offer appointment to him from the date of initial appointment on regular basis in terms of similar treatment having been granted to the incumbents similarly situated as the petitioner who stood appointed in these posts under the 3% quota meant for Persons with Disability (PWD) Act, 1995. This Original Application was disposed of by the learned Tribunal in the following terms:- 4. The learned counsel for the applicant states at the very outset that the case of the applicant is squarely covered under common judgment 30.10.2014, Annexure A-3, rendered by the Hon'ble High Court of Himachal Pradesh in CWP No.811 of 2011, Ashwani Kumar Versus Himachal Pradesh State Electricity Board & others and the connected matters. 5. the learned Standing Counsel states on behalf of the respondents that subject to verification of records, if it is found that the applicant is similarly situate as the petitioner in the aforesaid CWP No.811 of 2011 and the connected matters, his case shall also be considered accordingly. 6. In view of the above, the original application is disposed of in terms of the aforementioned judgment in CWP No.811 of 2011 and the connected matters, with a direction to the respondents/ competent authority that subject to the above verification and on finding the applicant to be similarly situate as above, benefit of the said judgment, if the same has attained finality and implemented, shall also be extended to him alongwith consequential benefits, if any, as per law, without any discrimination, within three months from the date of production of certified copy of this order by the applicant. 2. As no order was passed by the competent authority within the stipulated period of three months, the petitioner filed this contempt petition before the learned Tribunal which after abolition of the learned Tribunal stands transferred to this Court for the purpose of adjudication. 3. Alongwith the response which was filed to the present contempt petition, an order passed by the competent authority dated 13.06.2017 was also appended, vide which the representation of the petitioner stood dismissed on the ground that as the petitioner was recruited vide a drive in which there were persons of other categories also, i.e. Open Category, Scheduled Caste Category and Scheduled Tribe Category, who were offered appointment on contract basis, therefore, the petitioner was not entitled for the relief as was being prayed by him. 4. Rejoinder to the reply stands filed by the petitioner and it stands mentioned therein, as has also been argued by learned Senior Counsel, that Ashwani Kumar with whom parity was being drawn by the petitioner was similarly situated to the petitioner who was offered regular appointment by the respondent-board in terms of the order passed by the competent authority, appended with the rejoinder, dated 20.06.2015 (Annexure C-7) and the reasons which stand assigned by the competent authority while dismissing the representation of the petitioner are not only perverse but the act of the respondent-authority is also contemptuous and the same amounts to willful disobedience of the Court orders for the reasons that when on the basis of a direction passed by this Court in CWP No.811 of 2011, Ashwani Kumar Versus Himachal Pradesh State Electricity Board & others and the connected matters, decided on 30.10.2014, the competent authority regularized the services of an incumbents appointed under 3% reserve backlog posts meant for Person with Disability, then denying the same relief to the petitioner is nothing but contempt. Accordingly, a prayer has been made that appropriate action be taken against the respondents for willful disobedience of the Court orders. 5. Justifying the act of the respondent, Mr. Surinder Saklani, learned counsel for the respondent has argued that though it is not in dispute that both Ashwani Kumar and the petitioner have been appointed under 3% quota under the Persons with Disability (PWD) Act, 1995, however Ashwani Kumar alongwith other incumbents were appointed exclusively under a drive taken by Himachal Pradesh State Electricity Board to fill the backlog of vacancies available under the Persons with Disability (PWD) Act, 1995, but this was not the case with the petitioner as he although was recruited under the Persons with Disability (PWD) Act, 1995, but was recruited alongwith other incumbents belonging to General Category as well as Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribes Categories. 6. I have heard learned counsel for the parties and have gone through the pleadings. 7. A perusal of the order which has been passed by the competent authority, dated 13.06.2017, inter alia, demonstrates that the same has not been passed in terms of the judgment passed by the learned Tribunal vide order dated10.12.2015, in O.A. No.4735 of 2015. This Court is making the said observation for the following reasons:- Order dated 10.12.2015 demonstrates that it was contended before the learned Tribunal on behalf of the present petitioner that his case was squarely covered by the common judgment rendered by the High Court of Himachal Pradesh in CWP No.811 of 2011, Ashwani Kumar Versus Himachal Pradesh State Electricity Board & others and connected matters, decided on 30.10.2014. Thereafter, a holding out was made by the learned Standing Counsel for the Board before the learned Tribunal that subject to verification of records, if it was found that the applicant was indeed similarly situated as the petitioner in CWP No.811 of 2011 and other connected matters, his case shall be considered accordingly. It was in this backdrop that the learned Tribunal disposed of the Original Application by passing a direction that respondent/competent authority subject to the verification of the factum of the petitioner being similarly situated as Ashwani Kumar and on finding the petitioner to be similarly situated, extend the benefit of judgment if the same had attained finality and stood implemented alongwith consequential benefits, if any, as per law without any discrimination. 8. Now, incidently order dated 13.06.2017 has not dealt with the said directions passed by the learned Tribunal in letter and spirit. It appears that what weighed with the appropriate authority was more the mode of recruitment of the petitioner rather than his contention that as he stood recruited under 3% quota prescribed under the Persons with Disability (PWD) Act, 1995, as was Ashwani Kumar, therefore, he being similarly situated was entitled for similar relief as stood granted to Ashwani Kumar and that too by the Board itself by its decision dated 20.06.2015 (Annexure C-7), appended with the rejoinder. 9. To this effect, this Court is of the considered view that order dated 13.06.2017 suffers from infirmity as the same is not inconsonance with the directions issued by the learned Tribunal. It is thus but obvious that in view of the said observations made by the Court, order dated 13.06.2017 does not with stands the test of legality as it is not inconsonance with the directions passed by the learned Tribunal. 10. Now, in this background, the moot issue is as to what directions can be passed in the present Contempt Petition in order to ensure that substantive justice is imparted to the parties. 11. Hon'ble Supreme Court of India in AIR 1970 Supreme Court 1767, titled The Aligarh Municipal Board and others Versus Ekka Tonga Mazdoor Union and others has been pleased to hold that the contempt proceedings against a person who has failed to comply with the Court's order serves a dual purpose: (a) Vindication of the public interest by punishment of contemptuous conduct and (b) coercion to compel the contemner to do what the law required of him. 12. Accordingly, in order to impart substantive justice to the parties, this Contempt Petition is ordered to be closed by discharging the notice but with a direction that fresh order be passed by the authority concerned on the representation of the petitioner in terms of directions passed by the learned Tribunal in O.A. No.4735 of 2015, titled as Sanjeev Kumar Vs. Himachal Pradesh State Electricity Board & others, dated 10.12.2015, with specific reference to the judgment of Ashwani Kumar as well as per the decision taken by the Board of Directors as is reflected in publication dated 20.06.2015 appended with the rejoinder as Annexure C-7. 13. Now, needful shall be done by the competent authority on or before 30.11.2021 after giving an opportunity of being heard to the petitioner. October 25, 2021 (Ajay Mohan Goel) (rishi) Judge
summary: The Himachal Pradesh High Court (Justice Ajay Mohan Goel) delivered a judgment on October 25, 2021, in a Contempt Petition filed by Sanjeev Kumar against the Himachal Pradesh State Electricity Board (HPSEBL). The petitioner, a Junior Engineer appointed on a contract basis, sought compliance with an earlier direction from the erstwhile Administrative Tribunal. The original case, disposed of by the Tribunal on December 10, 2015, had directed the HPSEBL to consider the petitioner's case for regularization if he was found to be similarly situated to another employee, Ashwani Kumar, whose regularization had been ordered by the High Court in a previous judgment (CWP No. 811 of 2011). Both the petitioner and Ashwani Kumar had been appointed under the 3% quota reserved for Persons with Disability (PWD). Since the HPSEBL failed to comply within the stipulated time, the petitioner filed the contempt petition. In response, the Board produced an order dated June 13, 2017, dismissing the petitioner's representation. The Board argued that the petitioner was recruited in a drive that included General, SC, and ST categories, while Ashwani Kumar was part of an exclusive drive to clear the PWD backlog, making them dissimilarly situated. The petitioner countered that Ashwani Kumar was in fact regularized by the Board itself in 2015, and the grounds for denying relief to the petitioner were perverse and contemptuous. The High Court found the Board's order of June 13, 2017, to be infirm and not in consonance with the specific directions of the Tribunal. The Court observed that the Board focused on the mode of recruitment rather than the core contention: that both employees were recruited under the same PWD quota and one was already regularized by the Board. Stating that contempt proceedings serve to compel compliance and vindicate public interest, the Court chose not to punish the respondents immediately. Instead, the Court closed the contempt proceedings by discharging the notice but issued a clear, coercive direction: the competent authority must pass a fresh order on the petitioner's representation by November 30, 2021, specifically considering the judgment of Ashwani Kumar and the Board's own 2015 decision to regularize him, after granting the petitioner a hearing opportunity.

text: SELF-SWORN MARRIAGE AFFIDAVIT I, Mr. Rohan Mehta, holder of Indian Passport Number Z4583921, solemnly declare that I am married to Smt. Ananya Mehta (née Sharma) on 15/02/2018 (15th February 2018). I further declare that Smt. Ananya Mehta is currently my wife, as mentioned in my above-mentioned passport. I take full responsibility for this statement and will be solely responsible for any legal complications, if any, at a future date. Signature of Applicant: ___________________________ Full Name: Mr. Rohan Mehta Date: 29/10/2025 Place: New Delhi Signature of Spouse: ___________________________ Full Name: Mrs. Ananya Mehta Date: 29/10/2025 Place: New Delhi
summary: This document is a Self-Sworn Marriage Affidavit executed by a married couple, Mr. Rohan Mehta and Mrs. Ananya Mehta, on October 29, 2025, in New Delhi. Declarations Declarant: Mr. Rohan Mehta, identified by his Indian Passport Number Z4583921. Marriage Confirmation: Mr. Rohan Mehta solemnly declares that he is married to Smt. Ananya Mehta (née Sharma). Date of Marriage: The marriage took place on February 15, 2018. Current Status: Mr. Rohan Mehta confirms that Smt. Ananya Mehta is currently his wife, as is stated in his passport. Responsibility and Accountability Sole Responsibility: Mr. Rohan Mehta takes full responsibility for the accuracy of this statement. Legal Liability: He states that he will be solely responsible for any legal complications that may arise in the future concerning this declaration. Execution The affidavit is executed by the signature of Mr. Rohan Mehta (Applicant) and is counter-signed by Mrs. Ananya Mehta (Spouse) to confirm the declaration.

text: EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT This EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT is made in Jaipur on this 1st day of November, 2025 BETWEEN TechRise Software Solutions Private Limited, a company incorporated under the Companies Act, 2013, having its registered office at Plot No. 22, 2nd Floor, Malviya Nagar Industrial Area, Jaipur – 302017, Rajasthan, India (hereinafter referred to as the “Employer”), AND Mr. Rahul Mehta, S/o Mr. Suresh Mehta, residing at Flat No. 304, Sunrise Apartments, Vaishali Nagar, Jaipur – 302021, Rajasthan, hereinafter referred to as the “Employee.” (The Employer and the Employee are hereinafter jointly referred to as the “Parties”, and individually as a “Party.”) NOW THIS AGREEMENT WITNESSETH AND IT IS HEREBY AGREED BY AND BETWEEN THE PARTIES AS UNDER: 1. DESIGNATION The Employee is hereby appointed as a Software Developer of the Company on the terms and conditions contained hereunder. 2. PROBATIONARY PERIOD The probationary period shall be for a period of six (6) months, during which the Company will evaluate the Employee’s qualifications, skills, and overall suitability within the organization. During this probationary period or at any time of employment, the Company may terminate the working relationship without cause, with prior notice, except as prescribed by law. Upon satisfactory completion of the probationary period, the Employee shall be confirmed as a Regular Employee, eligible for benefits as per company policy. 3. PLACE OF WORK 3.1 The Employee will be stationed at the Employer’s office currently located in Jaipur, but the Company shall be entitled to transfer the Employee’s services to any of its branches, associate concerns, or future offices within or outside India. 3.2 The Employee may be required to work from client premises or other Company-assigned locations from time to time. 4. WORKING HOURS AND DUTIES The Employee shall work for 9 hours per day, Monday to Friday, with a one-hour lunch break, and shall perform all duties assigned by the Company diligently, following all organizational policies and code of conduct. 5. SALARY AND BENEFITS The Employee shall be paid a consolidated monthly salary of ?45,000/- (Rupees Forty-Five Thousand Only), subject to statutory deductions. The Employee will be entitled to: Casual Leave: 6 days per annum Sick Leave: 6 days per annum Earned Leave: 12 days per annum (after confirmation) Provident Fund and ESI contributions as per applicable law. 6. CONFIDENTIALITY The Employee shall maintain strict confidentiality regarding any proprietary, business, or client information of the Company and shall not disclose or misuse such information during or after the tenure of employment. 7. NON-COMPETE AND NON-SOLICITATION The Employee shall not, for a period of 12 months after leaving the Company, engage with or solicit clients or employees of the Company for any competing business without written permission of the Employer. 8. TERMINATION 8.1 The Company reserves the right to terminate the employment without notice for misconduct, breach of trust, fraud, or gross negligence. 8.2 The Employee may terminate this Employment Agreement by giving 30 days’ written notice to the Employer. The Employee shall not be entitled to receive salary for the notice period if the bond term of two (2) years is not completed. In case of bond breach, the Employee shall pay a penalty of ?2,00,000/- (Rupees Two Lakhs Only). 8.3 The Employer may terminate the Employee with immediate effect without any notice. 8.4 If the Employee leaves the Company before completing two years, the above-mentioned penalty of ?2,00,000/- shall apply, as the Company invests significant resources in training and developing new employees. 8.5 No severance pay shall be made if termination is due to breach of contract or failure to meet performance standards. 8.6 All company materials, documents, or data shall be returned upon termination. 8.7 If any fraud or illegal activity is committed by the Employee causing financial loss to the Company, the Employer may recover such losses through legal proceedings. 8.8 If the Employee resigns within 6 months of completing any paid training, the Company shall recover training expenses incurred. 8.9 The Company reserves the right to terminate employment immediately on grounds of: Dishonesty, misconduct, or willful negligence Violation of company rules or policies Insolvency, conviction, or medical unfitness 9. OTHER TERMS OF EMPLOYMENT The Employee shall comply with the Company Guidelines and HR Policies, which form an integral part of this Agreement. These policies are subject to amendment from time to time and are binding on all employees. 10. MISCELLANEOUS 10.1 This Agreement constitutes the entire understanding between the Parties and supersedes any prior arrangements. 10.2 This Agreement may only be amended or terminated by mutual written consent between the Employer and the Employee. 11. JURISDICTION 11.1 This Employment Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of India. 11.2 The courts at Jaipur, Rajasthan, shall have exclusive jurisdiction over all disputes arising from this Agreement. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties hereto have hereunto set and subscribed their respective hands on the day and year first hereinabove written. For TechRise Software Solutions Pvt. Ltd. (Employer) Signature: ___________________________ Name: Mr. Arjun Verma Designation: Director Date: November 1, 2025 Employee Signature: ___________________________ Name: Mr. Rahul Mehta Date: November 1, 2025 In the Presence of Witnesses: Name: Ms. Neha Sharma Address: 21, Civil Lines, Jaipur – 302006 Signature: ___________________________ Name: Mr. Karan Singh Address: 7, Malviya Nagar, Jaipur – 302017 Signature: ___________________________
summary: This agreement, effective November 1, 2025, establishes Mr. Rahul Mehta as a Software Developer for TechRise Software Solutions Private Limited in Jaipur, governed by the exclusive jurisdiction of courts in Jaipur, Rajasthan. The employment starts with a six (6) month probationary period, during which the Company evaluates suitability. The employee is hired for a consolidated monthly salary of ?45,000/-, plus statutory benefits (PF and ESI) and annual leave entitlements (6 Casual, 6 Sick, and 12 Earned Leaves after confirmation). A key condition of employment is the obligation for the employee to accept transfer to any of the Company's branches or future offices, both within or outside India. The contract includes stringent conditions regarding tenure and termination, particularly a compulsory service bond of two (2) years. If the employee voluntarily leaves before completing this two-year bond, or resigns without providing the 30 days' written notice, a significant penalty of ?2,00,000/- (Rupees Two Lakhs Only) applies. This penalty is justified by the Company's investment in training and development. Additionally, if the employee resigns within six months of completing any paid training, they must also reimburse the Company for the training expenses incurred. Post-employment restrictions are also clearly defined: the employee is bound by a Confidentiality clause and a Non-Compete and Non-Solicitation clause for 12 months after leaving the Company, prohibiting engagement with or solicitation of the Company’s clients or employees for any competing business. The Company retains the right to terminate employment immediately and without notice for serious grounds such as misconduct, fraud, or gross negligence, and no severance pay is offered for terminations due to breach of contract or performance failure.

text: GOVERNMENT OF KARNATAKA e-STAMP Certificate No.: IN-KA-98765432109876 Stamp Duty Paid: Rs. 15,000 Date of Purchase: 05/11/2024 Description of Document: COMMERCIAL LEASE DEED Property Details: Unit 401, Tech Park, Outer Ring Road, Bengaluru First Party: Excel Corporate Services Pvt. Ltd. Second Party: Zenith Software Solutions LLP COMMERCIAL LEASE AGREEMENT THIS COMMERCIAL LEASE AGREEMENT is made and executed on this 5th day of November, 2024, at Bengaluru. BETWEEN M/s. Excel Corporate Services Pvt. Ltd., a company incorporated under the Companies Act, 2013, having its registered office at 10, MG Road, Bengaluru 560001, acting through its authorized signatory Mr. Alok Reddy, hereinafter referred to as the "LESSOR" (which expression shall include its successors-in-interest and assigns) of the FIRST PART. AND M/s. Zenith Software Solutions LLP, a Limited Liability Partnership registered under the LLP Act, 2008, having its principal place of business at 705, Global Towers, Chennai 600006, acting through its designated partner Ms. Divya Menon, hereinafter referred to as the "LESSEE" (which expression shall include its partners, successors, and assigns) of the SECOND PART. WHEREAS the Lessor is the absolute owner of the commercial office space bearing Unit No. 401, 4th Floor, Tech Park, Outer Ring Road, Bengaluru 560103 (hereinafter referred to as the “DEMISED PREMISES”), admeasuring 5,000 sq. ft. of Super Built-up Area. NOW, THIS AGREEMENT WITNESSETH AS FOLLOWS: LEASE TERM: The Lease shall be for a fixed term of Three (3) years commencing from 15th November 2024 and expiring on 14th November 2027. RENT: The Lessee shall pay a fixed monthly Rent of Rs. 2,50,000/- (Rupees Two Lakh Fifty Thousand Only), payable in advance on or before the 7th day of every calendar month. SECURITY DEPOSIT: The Lessee shall pay an interest-free refundable Security Deposit of Rs. 15,00,000/- (Rupees Fifteen Lakh Only) to the Lessor, equivalent to six months' rent. LOCK-IN PERIOD: Both parties agree to a Lock-in Period of 12 (Twelve) months from the commencement date, during which neither party shall terminate this Agreement except for a material breach of terms. MAINTENANCE & CAM CHARGES: The Common Area Maintenance (CAM) charges shall be paid by the Lessee directly to the Society/Developer and are estimated at Rs. 25,000 per month. PERMITTED USE: The Demised Premises shall be used exclusively for the purpose of a Software Development Office/ITES Operations and allied administrative purposes. TAX DEDUCTION AT SOURCE (TDS): The Lessee shall deduct TDS at the prevailing rate as mandated under Section 194-I of the Income Tax Act, 1961, from the monthly rent and provide the necessary TDS certificate to the Lessor within the stipulated time. REGISTRATION: This Deed shall be compulsorily registered with the Sub-Registrar of Assurances, and the Stamp Duty and Registration charges shall be borne equally by the Lessor and the Lessee. IN WITNESS WHEREOF the parties have executed this Agreement on the day, month, and year first above written. WITNESSES: Sachin Kadam Signature: _________________________ Fariha Bano Signature: _________________________ LESSOR (For Excel Corporate Services Pvt. Ltd.) Signature: _________________________ Name: Mr. Alok Reddy (Authorized Signatory) LESSEE (For Zenith Software Solutions LLP) Signature: _________________________ Name: Ms. Divya Menon (Designated Partner)
summary: This Commercial Lease Agreement, executed on November 5, 2024, in Bengaluru, establishes a three (3) year fixed lease for Unit No. 401, Tech Park, Outer Ring Road (5,000 sq. ft. commercial office space) between Excel Corporate Services Pvt. Ltd. (Lessor) and Zenith Software Solutions LLP (Lessee), commencing November 15, 2024. The monthly Rent is fixed at Rs. 2,50,000/-, and the Lessee must pay a refundable, interest-free Security Deposit of Rs. 15,00,000/- (equivalent to six months' rent). A 12-month Lock-in Period is enforced, preventing termination except for material breach. The Lessee must use the premises exclusively for a Software Development Office/ITES Operations. The Lessee is responsible for paying Common Area Maintenance (CAM) charges (estimated at Rs. 25,000 per month) directly to the Society, and is obligated to deduct TDS from the monthly rent under Section 194-I of the Income Tax Act. Finally, the deed is compulsorily registrable, with the stamp duty and registration charges required to be borne equally by both the Lessor and the Lessee.

text: INDIA NON JUDICIAL KARNATAKA STATE E-Stamp Certificate No.: KA-BLR-2025-1123456789 Date: 15th October 2025 Value of Stamp Duty Paid: ?2,000/- (Rupees Two Thousand Only) Market Value of Property: ?15,00,000/- (Rupees Fifteen Lakhs Only) GIFT DEED This Deed of Gift is executed on 15th day of October, 2025 by Smt. Lakshmi Narayan, W/o Late Ramesh Narayan, Occupation: Retired Teacher, aged 62 years, residing at No. 12, Shanti Nilaya, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru, Karnataka - 560004, hereinafter called the DONOR. In favour of Mr. Arjun Narayan, S/o Late Ramesh Narayan, Occupation: Software Engineer, aged 34 years, residing at Flat No. 3B, Rosewood Apartments, Jayanagar 4th Block, Bengaluru - 560041, hereinafter called the DONEE. Whereas, the terms Donor and Donee, unless repugnant to the context, shall mean and include their respective heirs, successors, executors, administrators, trustees, legal representatives, and assigns. Whereas, the Donor herein is the sole and absolute owner of the immovable property bearing House No. 12, known as “Shanti Nilaya”, situated at Basavanagudi, Bengaluru, described in the Schedule hereunder written and hereinafter referred to as the Schedule Property. Whereas, the Donor had acquired the property by virtue of a Sale Deed dated 18th March 1990, registered as Document No. 456/1990 at the Sub-Registrar Office, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru, and has since been in peaceful possession and enjoyment thereof. Whereas, the Donee is the son of the Donor. Whereas, the Donor, out of natural love and affection, desires to grant the said property described in the Schedule hereunder to the Donee by way of Gift, subject to the conditions hereinafter mentioned. NOW THIS DEED WITNESSETH AS FOLLOWS: That the Donor, without any monetary consideration and purely out of natural love and affection, does hereby grant and transfer by way of Gift, the Schedule Property situated at Basavanagudi, Bengaluru, together with all buildings, structures, easements, and appurtenances attached thereto, to the Donee to have and to hold the same absolutely forever, subject to the payment of all taxes and dues hereafter chargeable by any competent authority. COVENANTS BY THE DONOR (a) That the Donor has absolute right, title, and authority to grant the Schedule Property by way of Gift. (b) That the Donee may at all times hereafter peacefully and quietly enter upon, take possession of, and enjoy the Schedule Property without any interruption, claim, or demand whatsoever from the Donor or any person claiming under or through her. (c) That the Donor and all persons lawfully claiming any estate or interest under or in trust for the Donor shall, at the request and cost of the Donee, execute such further documents and deeds as may be necessary for better assuring the property to the Donee. SCHEDULE OF THE PROPERTY (Gifted Under This Deed) All that piece and parcel of the immovable property bearing House No. 12, known as “Shanti Nilaya”, situated at Basavanagudi, Bengaluru, Karnataka - 560004, measuring 2,400 Sq. Ft. (40 ft × 60 ft), with building constructed thereon and bounded as follows: Direction Boundary Description East House No. 13, Shanti Nilaya Extension West 30 Feet Road South House No. 11, Raghavendra Nilaya North 30 Feet Road Market Value of the Property: ?15,00,000/- (Rupees Fifteen Lakhs Only) Stamp Duty Paid on the Market Value. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Donor as well as the Donee (by way of acceptance of the said gift) have put their respective hands on this 15th day of October, 2025, in the presence of the witnesses below. WITNESSES: Mr. Suresh Iyer, H.No. 8, Gandhi Bazaar Main Road, Bengaluru – 560004. Ms. Priya Menon, Flat 102, Ashoka Residency, Jayanagar 5th Block, Bengaluru – 560041. DONOR: (Signed) Smt. Lakshmi Narayan DONEE: (Signed) Mr. Arjun Narayan
summary: This Gift Deed, executed on October 15, 2025, in Bengaluru, formalizes the unconditional, non-monetary transfer of a residential property from Smt. Lakshmi Narayan (Donor) to her son, Mr. Arjun Narayan (Donee), out of natural love and affection. The gifted property is House No. 12, "Shanti Nilaya," situated at Basavanagudi, Bengaluru, measuring 2,400 Sq. Ft. The Donor covenants that she has the absolute right and title to the property and guarantees the Donee's peaceful and quiet enjoyment of the property forever, free from any claims from the Donor. The Donee accepts the gift, undertaking the responsibility for all future taxes and dues. The Deed confirms the Donor's original acquisition via a 1990 Sale Deed. The document is executed on Karnataka e-stamp paper with a stamp duty of ?2,000 paid on the declared market value of ?15,00,000/- (Rupees Fifteen Lakhs Only).

text: GOVERNMENT OF MAHARASHTRA E-STAMP CERTIFICATE No. MH-MUM-202510280015 Certificate Issued Date : 28/10/2025 Account Reference : NON-JUDICIAL Unique Doc Reference : MH/MUM/2025/10/28/0035678912 Purchased by : ARUN SHARMA Description of Document : DEED OF LEASE Property Value : ? 45,00,000/- Stamp Duty Paid : ? 3,15,000/- Registration Fee : ? 45,000/- Issued by : SHCIL Mumbai (Stock Holding Corporation of India Ltd.) Place of Issue : Mumbai, Maharashtra THIS DEED OF LEASE made at Mumbai this 28th day of October, 2025, between Mr. Arun Sharma, son of Late Vinod Sharma, resident of Flat No. 203, Sea Breeze Apartments, Juhu Tara Road, Mumbai – 400049, hereinafter referred to as "the Lessor" of the ONE PART and Mr. Rahul Nair, son of Raghavan Nair, resident of Flat No. 401, Orchid Residency, Andheri West, Mumbai – 400053, hereinafter referred to as "the Lessee" of the OTHER PART. WHEREAS the Lessor is the exclusive owner of piece of land bearing Plot No. B-17, situated at Versova, Andheri (West), Mumbai, more particularly described in the Schedule A hereunder written, hereinafter referred to as the demised premises. AND WHEREAS the Lessor has agreed to grant to the Lessee a lease in respect of the said premises for a period of 11 (Eleven) years, vide Agreement of premises lease dated 1st October 2025, hereinafter referred to as "the said agreement" subject to terms and conditions laid down in the said agreement. AND WHEREAS the Lessor has made out his marketable title to the demised premises free from all encumbrances, claims or reasonable doubts. NOW THIS DEED WITNESSETH AS FOLLOWS: The Lessor hereby demises unto the Lessee all that the land and premises described in the Schedule hereunder written together with the right to use the approach road, pathways and appurtenances thereto, for a period of 11 years, commencing from 1st November 2025 and ending on 31st October 2036, yielding and paying therefore during the said term the monthly rent of ? 40,000/- (Rupees Forty Thousand only) payable on or before the 5th day of each English calendar month, without any default. The Lessee has paid to the Lessor a sum of ? 1,20,000/- (Rupees One Lakh Twenty Thousand only) as refundable security deposit, to be returned to the Lessee on the termination or expiration of the lease after deduction of lawful dues, if any. The Lessee shall keep the demised premises in good and tenantable repair and condition and shall not make any structural alterations or additions without prior written consent of the Lessor. The Lessee shall use the demised premises only for residential purposes and shall not use the same for any commercial or unlawful purpose whatsoever. The Lessee shall pay the electricity, water and other utility charges regularly to the respective authorities and produce receipts to the Lessor when demanded. The Lessee shall hand over peaceful vacant possession of the premises on the expiry or earlier determination of this lease in good condition, reasonable wear and tear excepted. This Lease Deed shall be executed in duplicate. The original shall be retained by the Lessor and the duplicate by the Lessee. The stamp duty and all other expenses in respect of this Lease Deed and the duplicate thereof shall be borne and paid by the Lessee. The marginal notes and catch lines hereto are meant only for convenience of reference and shall not be taken into account in interpretation of these presents. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Lessor has set his hand unto these presents and a duplicate hereof and the Lessee has signed hereunder and upon a duplicate hereof on the day, month and year first hereinabove written. THE SCHEDULE A ABOVE REFERRED TO (Description of the demised premises) All that piece and parcel of land and structure bearing Plot No. B-17, admeasuring 2,400 square feet, situated at Versova, Andheri (West), Mumbai, Maharashtra, under the jurisdiction of Sub-Registrar of Assurances, Andheri, and bounded as follows: North : Land of Mr. Dinesh Patel South : Public Road East : House of Mr. Ramesh Mehta West : Open Land of Municipal Corporation SIGNED AND DELIVERED BY the within named LESSOR : Sd/- Arun Sharma SIGNED AND DELIVERED BY the within named LESSEE : Sd/- Rahul Nair WITNESSES: Mr. Suresh Iyer, S/o K. Iyer, R/o 7, Malad East, Mumbai – 400097. Ms. Priya Mehta, D/o R. Mehta, R/o 15, Juhu Lane, Mumbai – 400049.
summary: This Deed of Lease, executed on October 28, 2025, in Mumbai, establishes a long-term tenancy for a piece of land and structure (demised premises) bearing Plot No. B-17, Versova, Andheri (West), Mumbai, between Mr. Arun Sharma (Lessor) and Mr. Rahul Nair (Lessee). The lease is granted for a fixed and substantial period of eleven (11) years, commencing November 1, 2025, and ending October 31, 2036. The monthly rent is fixed at $\text{Rs. 40,000/-}$, payable by the 5th of each month, and the Lessee has paid a refundable Security Deposit of $\text{Rs. 1,20,000/-}$. The deed specifically covers the fact that it is a lease for the land and structure, and imposes a strict condition that the Lessee must use the premises only for residential purposes, prohibiting any commercial or unlawful use. A crucial clause mandates that the Lessee shall bear and pay the entire stamp duty and all other expenses for the execution and registration of this Deed and its duplicate. The property's value for stamp duty purposes was declared as $\text{Rs. 45,00,000}$.

text: ?100 NON-JUDICIAL STAMP PAPER GOVERNMENT OF TELANGANA Stamp Duty Paid Vide No. TG-2025HYD/00987654321 Dated: 28/10/2025 Value: Rupees One Hundred Only LOAN AGREEMENT BETWEEN Mr. Rajesh Kumar AND Ms. Priya Sharma THIS AGREEMENT made and entered into at Hyderabad this 28th day of October, 2025, BETWEEN Mr. Rajesh Kumar, S/o Late R. summary: This Loan Agreement, executed on October 28, 2025, in Hyderabad, documents a personal loan transaction between Mr. Rajesh Kumar (Lender) and Ms. Priya Sharma (Borrower), arising from their long-standing relationship. The core agreement is the grant of an interest-free loan of ?5,00,000/- (Rupees Five Lakhs Only) to the Borrower, specifically to enable her to purchase a residential flat. The loan is granted for a fixed period of two (2) years, commencing on November 1, 2025, and terminating on October 31, 2027. The Borrower explicitly agrees and undertakes to repay the entire principal amount in equal monthly instalments of ?20,833/- within this two-year period, and provides her personal guarantee for the repayment. The terms were established by the mutual consent of both parties.

text: NON-DISCLOSURE AND CONFIDENTIALITY AGREEMENT This Agreement dated 28th October 2025 is between TechVerse Consulting Pvt. Ltd. (“TechVerse”, Consultancy) No. 45, 2nd Floor, Orchid Enclave, Bannerghatta Road, Bengaluru – 560029, Karnataka, India on one part and UnionSys Technologies (“UnionSys”, Company) located at Radiant Arcade Building, Floor No: 3, Office No: 2, East Street, Camp, Pune: 411001, Maharashtra, INDIA on the other. In connection with a possible relationship between the Companies UnionSys and TechVerse Consulting Pvt. Ltd., The Company UnionSys and Consultancy TechVerse Consulting Pvt. Ltd. may be given access to certain business, commercial, financial and technological information concerning each other and their respective affiliates. UnionSys and TechVerse are each hereinafter referred to as a “Party” and collectively as “Parties.” As a condition of furnishing the aforementioned information, and for good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, the Parties agree to the provisions that follow in this Non-Disclosure & Confidentiality Agreement (“Agreement”): Confidential Material. The Parties will treat all business, commercial, financial and technological information, including marketing and customer information, business plans, software including object and source codes, trade secrets and all other proprietary information of the disclosing Party which is furnished to the other Party in writing or orally by or on behalf of the disclosing Party (herein collectively referred to as the "Confidential Material") in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement and will take or refrain from taking certain other actions herein set forth. The term "Confidential Material" does not include information which (i) either Party can clearly demonstrate to have been in its possession at the time Confidential Material is disclosed to such Party, provided that, such information is not known by such receiving Party to be subject to another confidentiality agreement with, or under other obligations of secrecy to, the other Party or another third party, or (ii) becomes generally available to the public other than as a result of a disclosure by the Party to which the Confidential Material is disclosed or by such Party's employees or agents, or (iii) becomes available to either Party on a non-confidential basis from a source other than the other Party, provided that, such source is not known by the receiving Party to be bound by a confidentiality agreement with, or other obligations of secrecy to, the other Party or another third party, or (iv) the Party that owns the Confidential Material consents in writing may be disclosed by the other Party. Disclosure. Each Party will receive Confidential Material in confidence and (except as required by court or governmental order, prompt notice of which is given by the receiving Party to the other Party, and with respect to which the other Party will cooperate with the receiving Party in obtaining a proper protective order) maintain such confidence with respect to each item of Confidential Material and will not disclose such item to any other person after its delivery to such Party, except only to persons in such Party's organization or professional advisers who need to have access to the Confidential Material for the purposes contemplated by this Agreement, each of whom has been made aware of the terms of this Agreement and agreed in writing to be bound by its terms. Each Party will be responsible for assuring compliance by such persons. Each Party will use Confidential Material solely for the purposes contemplated by this Agreement. Property Rights. All Confidential Material delivered to each Party is and shall remain the property of the disclosing Party. Written Confidential Material, and all copies thereof, shall be returned to each disclosing Party upon the termination of the Parties' relationship or upon written request by the disclosing Party, whichever occurs first. Each Party will destroy all documents, memoranda, notes and other writings whatsoever prepared by it based on the information in Confidential Material or containing such Party's analysis thereof, and each Party shall certify in writing to the other Party that such destruction has taken place. The Parties may not retain any copy of Confidential Material or such other document described in this paragraph. No Warranty. Each Party makes no warranty or representation as to the accuracy or completeness of any Confidential Material. Such warranty or representation shall be made, if at all, in a definitive agreement between the Parties, as appropriate; provided that, nothing in this Agreement shall require the Parties to enter into such definitive agreement. Intellectual Property. a. Nothing in this Agreement shall be deemed to be a grant by either Party of any express or implied license under any intellectual or other property of the other Party or the intellectual property of either of the Parties' affiliates. To the extent that either Party generates works of authorship (which shall be deemed to be "works for hire"), copyrightable material, inventions, trademarks, trade dress or other intellectual property in connection with the Confidential Material (hereinafter collectively referred to as "Intellectual Property"), such Intellectual Property shall be the property of the other Party. In any event, all such Intellectual Property, and all rights therein created by either Party, will be, and are hereby deemed to be, assigned and transferred by this Agreement to the other Party, its successors and assigns. Such Party, its successors and assigns, will have the exclusive right to obtain copyright, patent and/or trademark registrations or other protection of the Intellectual Property (including, without limitation, maintaining such Intellectual Property as trade secrets) in such Party's own name, or in the names of its successors or assigns, as inventor, author and/or owner and to secure any renewals and extensions of such protection throughout the world. If such Party chooses to maintain any part or all of the Intellectual Property as a trade secret, such Party shall so inform the other Party and the other Party shall maintain such Intellectual Property as confidential to the same extent as it maintains the confidentiality of its own most-confidential information. b. Each Party hereby acknowledges that it retains no rights whatsoever with respect to the aforementioned Intellectual Property of the other Party, including, but not limited to, any rights to reproduce such Intellectual Property, make, have made, use and/or sell products based upon the Intellectual Property, or otherwise prepare derivatives thereof, file patent, copyright or trademark applications with respect thereto, distribute copies of any Intellectual Property in any manner whatsoever, exhibit, use or display any such Intellectual Property publicly or otherwise, or license or assign to any third party the right to do any of the foregoing. Each Party will execute all documents as may be required by the other Party to affect the ownership rights as provided in this Agreement or otherwise to further the purpose of this paragraph Jurisdiction: In the event of breach of either Party's obligations under this Agreement, the non-breaching Party shall have the right to have such obligation specifically enforced by a court of competent jurisdiction, including, without limitation, the right to entry of restraining orders and injunctions, whether preliminary, mandatory, temporary, or permanent, against a violation, threatened or actual, and whether or not continuing, of such obligation, without the necessity of showing any particular injury or damage, it being acknowledged and agreed that any such breach or threatened breach would cause irreparable injury to the non-breaching Party and that money damages would not provide an adequate remedy. In addition, the non-breaching Party may pursue other rights and remedies that may be available to it under this Agreement, at law or in equity in the event of any such violation, and any right or remedy so pursued shall be independent of any other right or remedy, and all such rights and remedies shall be severally enforceable. In the event that non-breaching Party commences legal action or seeks legal advice to enforce the breaching Party's obligations under this Agreement, the breaching Party shall be responsible for all costs of such action and advice, including, without limitation, reasonable attorneys' fees. Each Party hereby irrevocably consents that any legal action against it arising out of or in any matter relating to this Agreement shall be brought in the Indian Court for Pune. By each Party's execution and delivery of this Agreement, such Party hereby irrevocably consents to the jurisdiction of such courts and waives any defense based upon improper venue, inconvenient venue or forum or lack of jurisdiction. Miscellaneous: This Agreement is for the benefit of each of the Parties and their respective affiliates and shall be governed and construed in accordance with the laws of India. Each Party shall have no right to assign any of its rights under this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other Party, and any such attempted assignment shall be null and void. If any provision of this Agreement is tied invalid or unenforceable, such invalidity or unenforceability shall not affect the validity or enforceability of the other provisions hereof, all of which are severable. No failure by either Party to exercise any right under this Agreement shall operate as a waiver of such right or of any other right, nor shall any exercise of any right hereunder preclude any other or further exercise thereof or the exercise of any other right. Each Party’s obligations under this Agreement shall survive the termination of the relationship between the Parties. This Agreement shall be binding upon the successors and permitted assigns of each Party. No waiver hereunder shall be effective unless in writing and signed by the waving Party. This Agreement contains the entire agreement and all representations and discussions between the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and all prior and contemporary discussions, representations, disclosures, agreements, and understandings with respect to the subject matter hereof are superseded by this Agreement, which may be amended only by an instrument signed by each Party. Non-Solicitation: a) During the term of this agreement and for a period of one (1) year subsequent to the termination of this agreement, Consultant shall not, without the prior consent of Company, directly, indirectly, or through any other party solicit business from or perform services for any direct or indirect Company customer or any other prospective Company customer whom Consultant had any contact with or exposure to at any time during the term of this agreement. b) Either party agrees that, during the term of this Agreement and for a period of one (1) year of the termination of this Agreement, neither party nor any of its affiliates or their respective personnel shall directly or indirectly employ, contract, solicit, hire or otherwise utilize the services of an existing employee, consultant, former employee, or former consultant of either party during preceding twelve months. Non-Compete: During the term of this agreement and for a period of one (1) year subsequent to the termination of this agreement, Consultant shall not, without the prior consent of Company, directly, indirectly, or through any other party engage in, or perform services for any business which is competing with Company directly or indirectly. Confidentiality Period: This Agreement and Recipient's duty to hold Confidential Information in confidence shall expire five (5) years after the end of the Disclosure Period, except that any technical designs, source code and protocols (including documents and other embodiments of such information) (specifically including without limitation, API's) shall be deemed and treated as Confidential Information under this Agreement for as long as such information continues to be protectable as trade secret information under applicable law. The signatures below indicate agreement in respect of all of the matters set forth in this Agreement. Upon execution, this Agreement shall become a legally binding agreement between the Parties. The Agreement shall remain in effect until terminated by either Party with a written notice given to the other Party. For: UnionSys Technologies By: ________________________ Name: Salim A. W. Shaikh Title: Founder & Director Date: 28/10/2025 For: TechVerse Consulting Pvt. Ltd. By: ________________________ Name: Anisha Rao Title: Chief Executive Officer Date: 28/10/2025 Witnesses: Rohan Mehta, Pune, Maharashtra Priya Nair, Bengaluru, Karnataka
summary: This Mutual Non-Disclosure and Confidentiality Agreement, dated October 28, 2025, is between TechVerse Consulting Pvt. Ltd. (Bengaluru, Consultancy) and UnionSys Technologies (Pune, Company) to govern the exchange of sensitive business, financial, and technological information for a possible working relationship. The core confidentiality duty for most information is a fixed five (5) years after the end of the disclosure period, with specific technical items like source code and protocols being protected for as long as they qualify as a trade secret under applicable law. A unique and significant clause states that any Intellectual Property generated in connection with the Confidential Material by either party during the discussions is automatically assigned and transferred to the other Party (the one that didn't generate it), and the generating party retains no rights whatsoever to it, a severe restriction usually clarified in separate joint development agreements. Furthermore, the agreement imposes post-termination restrictions on the Consultancy (TechVerse), including a one (1) year Non-Solicitation clause prohibiting contact with Company customers and a one (1) year Non-Compete clause prohibiting engagement in competing business without the Company's consent. Both parties are also bound by a one (1) year Non-Solicitation against hiring the other party's personnel. The agreement provides for specific performance and injunctions against breach, with the Indian Courts at Pune having irrevocable consent and jurisdiction for legal action.
